This is kept separate from the current changelog to keep page navigation faster while retaining older updates.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;
&lt;h2 class=&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;august-23---september-5-2023&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-august-23-september-5-2023&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;August 23 - September 5, 2023&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to August 23 - September 5, 2023&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#august-23---september-5-2023&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
&lt;li&gt;The &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/docs/working-with-databases&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Working with databases guide&lt;/a&gt; was revised to improve its readability and to make additional resources easier to find.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;Notion&amp;#x27;s &lt;a href=&quot;https://www.postman.com/notionhq/workspace/notion-s-api-workspace/collection/15568543-d990f9b7-98d3-47d3-9131-4866ab9c6df2&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Postman collection&lt;/a&gt; for the API was updated. Be sure to pull recent changes into your forked version.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;A reminder was added to the &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/create-a-comment&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Comments endpoints&lt;/a&gt; to update &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/capabilities&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;integration capabilities&lt;/a&gt; for comments prior to using the endpoints. (Read/write comment capabilities are off by default and can be turned on in the &lt;a href=&quot;https://www.notion.so/my-integrations&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;integration dashboard&lt;/a&gt;.)&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;General clean-up and improvements, including code formatting.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;h2 class=&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;august-8---august-22-2023&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-august-8-august-22-2023&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;August 8 - August 22, 2023&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to August 8 - August 22, 2023&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#august-8---august-22-2023&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
&lt;li&gt;The &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/docs/create-a-notion-integration&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Build your first integration&lt;/a&gt; guide was rewritten with new demo code to help developers learn how to use Notion‚Äôs API even faster.
&lt;ul&gt;
&lt;li&gt;A new &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js/tree/main/examples/web-form-with-express&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;sample app&lt;/a&gt; was added to the &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js/tree/main&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Notion SDK for JavaScript&lt;/a&gt; &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;/examples&lt;/code&gt; directory. This completed sample app is referenced in the new &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/docs/create-a-notion-integration&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Build your first integration&lt;/a&gt; guide.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;The description for the &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;block_id&lt;/code&gt; path parameter was updated for the &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/patch-block-children&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Append block children&lt;/a&gt; endpoint to indicate that a block ID or page ID can be used.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;A clarification was added to &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/retrieve-a-database&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;documentation&lt;/a&gt; for retrieving/updating database properties: If a property is based on a relation to another database, the related database also needs to be shared with the integration.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;A clarification was added to documentation for &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/post-database-query-filter#multi-select&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;querying databases&lt;/a&gt;. When filtering a multi-select property, the &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;contains&lt;/code&gt; field will filter for exact matches for the string provided.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;The &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/docs/working-with-comments&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Working with comments&lt;/a&gt; guide was updated with additional examples to distinguish between creating page comments and inline discussion comments.
&lt;ul&gt;
&lt;li&gt;The &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/create-a-comment&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Create a comment&lt;/a&gt; endpoint description now links to the Working with comments guide to help developers find additional resources faster.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;If you haven‚Äôt already, join our &lt;a href=&quot;https://join.slack.com/t/notiondevs/shared_invite/zt-20b5996xv-DzJdLiympy6jP0GGzu3AMg&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Notion Devs Slack group&lt;/a&gt; to learn from other developers building with the public API.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;h3 class=&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;notice-for-an-upcoming-public-api-change&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-notice-for-an-upcoming-public-api-change&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Notice for an upcoming Public API change&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Notice for an upcoming Public API change&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#notice-for-an-upcoming-public-api-change&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
&lt;h4 class=&quot;heading heading-4 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;we-will-soon-be-rolling-out-changes-to-the-formulas-property-formulas-20-and-as-such-we-will-be-making-a-change-to-the-notion-public-api&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-we-will-soon-be-rolling-out-changes-to-the-formulas-property-formulas-2-0-and-as-such-we-will-be-making-a-change-to-the-notion-public-api&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;We will soon be rolling out changes to the Formulas property (Formulas 2.0), and as such, we will be making a change to the Notion Public API.&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to We will soon be rolling out changes to the Formulas property (Formulas 2.0), and as such, we will be making a change to the Notion Public API.&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#we-will-soon-be-rolling-out-changes-to-the-formulas-property-formulas-20-and-as-such-we-will-be-making-a-change-to-the-notion-public-api&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h4&gt;
&lt;p&gt;This is a non-versioned change and is expected to be in effect in the next couple weeks.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;tl;dr:&lt;/strong&gt; As part of the Formulas 2.0 rollout, the Public API‚Äôs format of the string value for &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/property-object#formula&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;formula.expression&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/a&gt; will be changing. Public API calls with formula inputs in the old format will still succeed. On write operations, the old format will be supported indefinitely, but on read, only the new format will be returned. This change is being made to improve the formulas experience and ensure parity with the Notion app. &lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;No action is required for creating or updating database formulas. Reading database &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/property-object#formula&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;formula.expression&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/a&gt; values may require developer changes.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;h4 class=&quot;heading heading-4 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;what-do-you-need-to-know&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-what-do-you-need-to-know&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;What do you need to know?&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to What do you need to know?&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#what-do-you-need-to-know&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h4&gt;
&lt;p&gt; &lt;strong&gt;The string value of &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;formula.expression&lt;/code&gt; is changing; the schema is not.&lt;/strong&gt; &lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
&lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;On write&lt;/strong&gt; via the Public API (&lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/create-a-database&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;create&lt;/a&gt; or &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/update-a-database&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;update&lt;/a&gt; database endpoints), Notion will support using the old format as a Public API input in the formula property schema indefinitely &lt;em&gt;and&lt;/em&gt; will support writing in the &lt;strong&gt;new&lt;/strong&gt; format.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;Database objects returned via the Public API will have the new formulas 2.0 format.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar&quot; role=&quot;tablist&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=&quot;true&quot; class=&quot;CodeTabs_active&quot; role=&quot;tab&quot; type=&quot;button&quot;&gt;JavaScript&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-inner&quot; role=&quot;tabpanel&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang-javascript theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;javascript&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;// Old format
&amp;quot;Updated price&amp;quot;: {
  &amp;quot;id&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;YU%7C%40&amp;quot;,
  &amp;quot;name&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Updated price&amp;quot;,
  &amp;quot;type&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;formula&amp;quot;,
  &amp;quot;formula&amp;quot;: {
    &amp;quot;expression&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;prop(\&amp;quot;Price\&amp;quot;) * 2&amp;quot;
  }
}

// New format (upcoming)
&amp;quot;Updated price&amp;quot;: {
  &amp;quot;id&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;YU%7C%40&amp;quot;,
  &amp;quot;name&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Updated price&amp;quot;,
  &amp;quot;type&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;formula&amp;quot;,
  &amp;quot;formula&amp;quot;: {
      &amp;quot;expression&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;{{notion:block_property:BtVS:00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000:8994905a-074a-415f-9bcf-d1f8b4fa38e4}}/2&amp;quot;
  }
}
&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;h4 class=&quot;heading heading-4 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;why-is-this-happening&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-why-is-this-happening&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Why is this happening?&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Why is this happening?&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#why-is-this-happening&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h4&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Notion databases allow you to build a fully customizable system for you and your team ‚Äì they provide a place where you can keep all your information in one place, with the ability to build views, filters, and workflows that can be adapted to your needs. &lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The formula property helps you take that even further ‚Äì allowing you to perform calculations, create specialized views, and provide an extra layer of insight based on information in other database properties. It helps expand what you can do in Notion databases.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;We are improving the formulas experience so that: &lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ol&gt;
&lt;li&gt;It‚Äôs easier to write formulas.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;Formula outputs look and feel more native to Notion.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;The formula language can fulfill more specific needs.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ol&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Changes being made to the API are to ensure parity with the Notion app. &lt;/p&gt;
&lt;h4 class=&quot;heading heading-4 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;what-do-you-need-to-do&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-what-do-you-need-to-do&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;What do you need to do?&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to What do you need to do?&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#what-do-you-need-to-do&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h4&gt;
&lt;p&gt;This is a non-versioned change that will not affect most developers. As mentioned, the formula property format will still have the same schema in the Public API; only the value of the &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;formula.expression&lt;/code&gt; field will change.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Keep an eye on this changelog for when the update becomes available in the Public API.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;h2 class=&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;july-25---august-7-2023&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-july-25-august-7-2023&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;July 25 - August 7, 2023&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to July 25 - August 7, 2023&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#july-25---august-7-2023&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
&lt;li&gt;Notion is excited to announce our &lt;a href=&quot;https://www.notion.so/technology-partner-program&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Technology Partnership Program&lt;/a&gt;. üéâ This program is open to companies who have built a public integration (including Link Previews) and are interested in improving and scaling their integration with Notion‚Äôs support. If you think your integration and company could be a fit, &lt;a href=&quot;https://www.notion.so/technology-partner-program&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;learn more and apply here&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;We‚Äôve updated our API reference docs to include information on Notion‚Äôs &lt;a href=&quot;https://www.notion.so/help/wikis-and-verified-pages&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;wiki databases and verified pages&lt;/a&gt;. Updates include:
&lt;ul&gt;
&lt;li&gt;An overview on wikis in the guide to &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/docs/working-with-databases#properties&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;working with databases&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;The &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/page-property-values#verification&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;verification&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/a&gt; page property was added to the &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/page-property-values&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Page properties&lt;/a&gt; documentation.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;The &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/create-a-database&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Create a database&lt;/a&gt; and &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/post-database-query&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Query a database&lt;/a&gt; endpoint documentation was updated to reflect API changes related to wikis. Namely, that querying wiki databases can return both &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/page&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Page&lt;/a&gt; and &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/database&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Database&lt;/a&gt; objects.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;The &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/status-codes#error-codes&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Error codes&lt;/a&gt; section in the &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/status-codes&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Status code&lt;/a&gt; page was updated to include examples of the &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;&amp;quot;message&amp;quot;&lt;/code&gt; returned with each type of API error, as well as descriptions of the issue each error code represents.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;A number of sample cURL commands in our docs were still using an old &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/versioning&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Notion Version&lt;/a&gt; in their headers. These have all been updated.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;A clarification was added to the &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/docs/authorization#making-api-requests-with-an-internal-integration&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Authorization guide&lt;/a&gt; that the &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/versioning&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Notion Version&lt;/a&gt; is always required in public API request headers.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;h2 class=&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;july-11---july-24-2023&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-july-11-july-24-2023&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;July 11 - July 24, 2023&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to July 11 - July 24, 2023&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#july-11---july-24-2023&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
&lt;li&gt;A new integration &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js/tree/main/examples/parse-text-from-any-block-type&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;example&lt;/a&gt; was added to the Notion SDK for JavaScript repo. This example shows how to get the plain text from any block type currently supported by the public API.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;The new unique ID page property was added to the &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/page-property-values&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Page properties&lt;/a&gt; documentation. When used, the unique ID (&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;unique_id&lt;/code&gt;) auto-increments for every new page created in a database. An optional prefix can be included that will be applied to the ID values.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;figure&gt;&lt;span aria-label=&quot;The unique ID in a Notion page&amp;#x27;s properties&quot; class=&quot;img lightbox closed&quot; role=&quot;button&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;lightbox-inner&quot;&gt;&lt;img alt=&quot;The unique ID in a Notion page&amp;#x27;s properties&quot; loading=&quot;lazy&quot; src=&quot;https://files.readme.io/c599280-unique_id.png&quot; align=&quot;center&quot; class=&quot;&quot; width=&quot;600px&quot; caption=&quot;&quot; height=&quot;auto&quot; title=&quot;&quot;/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;figcaption&gt;&lt;p&gt;The unique ID in a Notion page&amp;#x27;s properties&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/figcaption&gt;&lt;/figure&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
&lt;li&gt;Workspace Owners can now see &lt;em&gt;all&lt;/em&gt; internal integrations created in a workspace via the &lt;a href=&quot;https://www.notion.so/my-integrations&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;integration dashboard&lt;/a&gt;. This includes integrations created by themselves and other Workspace Owners. We‚Äôve included this information in our &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/docs/getting-started#internal-integrations&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Getting Started&lt;/a&gt; guide.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;A &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Notion SDK for JavaScript&lt;/a&gt; code sample was added to the &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/create-a-database&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Create a database&lt;/a&gt; endpoint documentation.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;h2 class=&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;june-13---july-10-2023&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-june-13-july-10-2023&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;June 13 - July 10, 2023&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to June 13 - July 10, 2023&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#june-13---july-10-2023&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
&lt;li&gt;We updated our &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/docs&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Getting started guide&lt;/a&gt; to help developers who are new to the public API better understand how the API relates to integrations.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;The &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/block#embed&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Block object&lt;/a&gt; docs were updated with a tip on how to embed Vimeo links in a Notion page via the API.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;A new &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;after&lt;/code&gt; parameter has been added to the &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/patch-block-children&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Append block children&lt;/a&gt; endpoint. Developers can now specific where to append a new block, instead of appending it to the end of a parent block by default.
&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar&quot; role=&quot;tablist&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=&quot;true&quot; class=&quot;CodeTabs_active&quot; role=&quot;tab&quot; type=&quot;button&quot;&gt;cURL&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-inner&quot; role=&quot;tabpanel&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang-curl theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;curl&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;curl -X PATCH https://api.notion.com/v1/blocks/16d8004e-5f6a-42a6-9811-51c22ddada12/children \
  -H &amp;#x27;Authorization: Bearer &amp;#x27;&amp;quot;$NOTION_API_KEY&amp;quot;&amp;#x27;&amp;#x27; \
  -H &amp;quot;Content-Type: application/json&amp;quot; \
  -H &amp;quot;Notion-Version: 2022-06-28&amp;quot; \
  --data &amp;#x27;{
    &amp;quot;children&amp;quot;: [
    ...
    }
  ], after: &amp;quot;&amp;lt;block_id_to_append_after&amp;gt;&amp;quot;
}&amp;#x27;
&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;The &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/docs/authorization&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Authorization guide&lt;/a&gt; had a clarification added to help developers find the resources they need for &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/docs/link-previews&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Link Preview&lt;/a&gt; integrations.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;The new &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;public_url&lt;/code&gt; property was added to the docs. When a page or database has been shared publicly, the response body will include a &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;public_url&lt;/code&gt; value.
&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar&quot; role=&quot;tablist&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=&quot;true&quot; class=&quot;CodeTabs_active&quot; role=&quot;tab&quot; type=&quot;button&quot;&gt;JSON&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-inner&quot; role=&quot;tabpanel&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang-json theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;json&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;{
  &amp;quot;object&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;page&amp;quot;,
  &amp;quot;id&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;&amp;lt;id&amp;gt;&amp;quot;,
  &amp;quot;created_time&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;2023-06-02T19:54:00.000Z&amp;quot;,
  &amp;quot;last_edited_time&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;2023-06-02T23:04:00.000Z&amp;quot;,
  &amp;quot;created_by&amp;quot;: { ... },
  &amp;quot;last_edited_by&amp;quot;: { ... },
  &amp;quot;cover&amp;quot;: null,
  &amp;quot;icon&amp;quot;: null,
  &amp;quot;parent&amp;quot;: { ... },
  &amp;quot;archived&amp;quot;: false,
  &amp;quot;properties&amp;quot;: { ... },
  &amp;quot;url&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;&amp;lt;url&amp;gt;&amp;quot;,
  &amp;quot;public_url&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;&amp;lt;public-url&amp;gt;&amp;quot;
} 
&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;The &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/get-block-children&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Retrieve block children&lt;/a&gt; endpoint documentation was updated to help developers who are new to the public API better understand the endpoint‚Äôs functionality.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;The &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/retrieve-a-block&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Retrieve a block&lt;/a&gt; endpoint documentation was updated with some additional information related to working with page content.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;The &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;invalid_grant&lt;/code&gt; code was added to our &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/status-codes&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Status codes&lt;/a&gt; documentation. This code is returned when the authorization grant (e.g. token) provided is invalid. For example, a status code &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;400&lt;/code&gt; with an &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;invalid_grant&lt;/code&gt; code will be returned when the token provided has expired.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;The &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/rich-text&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Rich text&lt;/a&gt; documentation was updated with additional information on what rich text is and how the Notion uses it.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;h2 class=&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;may-30---june-12-2023&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-may-30-june-12-2023&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;May 30 - June 12, 2023&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to May 30 - June 12, 2023&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#may-30---june-12-2023&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
&lt;li&gt;Our guides and docs related to Link Preview integrations have been updated to help developers find the information they need faster.&lt;br/&gt;
Improvements have been made to the following guides and API reference docs:
&lt;ul&gt;
&lt;li&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/docs/getting-started&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Getting started guide&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/docs/link-previews&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Introduction to Link Previews guide&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/docs/build-a-link-preview-integration&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Building a Link Preview integration guide&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/unfurl-attribute-object&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Unfurl attribute object docs&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;We added more information about the &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;plain_text&lt;/code&gt; property found in the &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;rich_text&lt;/code&gt; object. Learn more about rich text in our &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/rich-text&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Rich text object&lt;/a&gt; docs.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;The docs related to &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/post-database-query-filter&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;filtering&lt;/a&gt; and &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/post-database-query-sort&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;sorting&lt;/a&gt; database queries now have more code examples for developers building integrations with the &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Notion SDK for JavaScript&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;We reorganized the REST API reference navigation bar after removing the ‚ÄúOther‚Äù section to make its child pages easier to find.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;h2 class=&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;may-16---may-29-2023&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-may-16-may-29-2023&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;May 16 - May 29, 2023&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to May 16 - May 29, 2023&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#may-16---may-29-2023&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
&lt;li&gt;The &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/post-database-query&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Query a database&lt;/a&gt; and &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/post-database-query-filter&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Filter database entries&lt;/a&gt; docs were updated with additional code examples of passing single and multiple filters.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;The &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/docs/working-with-comments&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Working with comments&lt;/a&gt; guide was updated to clarify how to retrieve and add comments using the REST API.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;The references docs for &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;rollup&lt;/code&gt; &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/page-property-values#rollup&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;page properties&lt;/a&gt;, as well as the &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/retrieve-a-page-property&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Retrieve a page property&lt;/a&gt; and &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/retrieve-a-page&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Retrieve a page&lt;/a&gt; endpoints were updated with additional information related to limitations. In cases where a page property ‚Äî like a rollup ‚Äî has more than 25 references, the &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/retrieve-a-page-property&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Retrieve a page property&lt;/a&gt; endpoint must be used to receive a complete response.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;An outdated Changelog URL now redirects to this Changelog page to help avoid confusion.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;h2 class=&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;may-2---may-15-2023&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-may-2-may-15-2023&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;May 2 - May 15, 2023&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to May 2 - May 15, 2023&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#may-2---may-15-2023&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
&lt;li&gt;We added a database schema size recommendation of &lt;strong&gt;50KB&lt;/strong&gt; to our docs to help developers manage their database query performance. It is strongly recommended that developers keep their schema size under this number.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;The &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/update-a-database&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Update a database&lt;/a&gt; page was updated to improve readability. Additional information on how this endpoint differs from related endpoints was also added to help developers better navigate the REST API docs.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;The &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/post-database-query#errors&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Query a database&lt;/a&gt; page was updated with additional information about the &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;filter_properties&lt;/code&gt; query parameter.&lt;br/&gt;
When used with the REST API, this query parameter is passed as a string, like so:&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;https://api.notion.com/v1/databases/[database_id]/query?filter_properties=[property_id_1]&amp;amp;filter_properties=[property_id_2]
&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;
&lt;p&gt;When used with the &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;JavaScript SDK&lt;/a&gt;, the &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;filter_properties&lt;/code&gt; option accepts an array of property ID strings:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar&quot; role=&quot;tablist&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=&quot;true&quot; class=&quot;CodeTabs_active&quot; role=&quot;tab&quot; type=&quot;button&quot;&gt;JavaScript&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-inner&quot; role=&quot;tabpanel&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang-javascript theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;javascript&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;notion.databases.query({
	database_id: &amp;#x27;databaseID&amp;#x27;,
	filter_properties: [&amp;quot;propertyID1&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;propertyID2&amp;quot;]
})
&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
