Trying to include users of type &amp;quot;bot&amp;quot; will return a validation error. Existing mentions of bot users is unaffected.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;h2 class=&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;july-1-2021&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-july-1-2021&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;July 1, 2021&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to July 1, 2021&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#july-1-2021&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;
&lt;h3 class=&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;page-objects-now-contain-url&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-page-objects-now-contain-url&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Page objects now contain url&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Page objects now contain url&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#page-objects-now-contain-url&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;/reference/page#all-pages&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Page objects&lt;/a&gt; now return the web address of the page in the &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;url&lt;/code&gt; key. &lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar&quot; role=&quot;tablist&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=&quot;true&quot; class=&quot;CodeTabs_active&quot; role=&quot;tab&quot; type=&quot;button&quot;&gt;JSON&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-inner&quot; role=&quot;tabpanel&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang-json theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;json&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;{
  &amp;quot;object&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;page&amp;quot;,
  &amp;quot;id&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;251d2b5f-268c-4de2-afe9-c71ff92ca95c&amp;quot;,
	&amp;quot;created_time&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;2020-03-17T19:10:04.968Z&amp;quot;,
	&amp;quot;last_edited_time&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;2020-03-17T21:49:37.913Z&amp;quot;,
  &amp;quot;parent&amp;quot;: {
    &amp;quot;type&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;database_id&amp;quot;,
    &amp;quot;database_id&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;48f8fee9-cd79-4180-bc2f-ec0398253067&amp;quot;
  },
  &amp;quot;archived&amp;quot;: false,
  &amp;quot;url&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;https://www.notion.so/Avocado-251d2b5f268c4de2afe9c71ff92ca95c&amp;quot;,
  &amp;quot;properties&amp;quot;: {
    &amp;quot;Name&amp;quot;: {
      &amp;quot;id&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;title&amp;quot;,
      &amp;quot;type&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;title&amp;quot;,
      &amp;quot;title&amp;quot;: [
        {
          &amp;quot;type&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;text&amp;quot;,
          &amp;quot;text&amp;quot;: {
            &amp;quot;content&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Avocado&amp;quot;,
            &amp;quot;link&amp;quot;: null
          },
          &amp;quot;annotations&amp;quot;: {
            &amp;quot;bold&amp;quot;: false,
            &amp;quot;italic&amp;quot;: false,
            &amp;quot;strikethrough&amp;quot;: false,
            &amp;quot;underline&amp;quot;: false,
            &amp;quot;code&amp;quot;: false,
            &amp;quot;color&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;default&amp;quot;
          },
          &amp;quot;plain_text&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Avocado&amp;quot;,
          &amp;quot;href&amp;quot;: null
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}
&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;This impacts endpoints that return page object: the &lt;a href=&quot;/reference/page&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;pages&lt;/a&gt; endpoints and &lt;a href=&quot;/reference/post-database-query&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;query database&lt;/a&gt; endpoint.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;h2 class=&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;june-28-2021&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-june-28-2021&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;June 28, 2021&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to June 28, 2021&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#june-28-2021&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;
&lt;h3 class=&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;last-edited-and-created-time-properties-are-now-rounded-to-the-nearest-minute&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-last-edited-and-created-time-properties-are-now-rounded-to-the-nearest-minute&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Last edited and created time properties are now rounded to the nearest minute&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Last edited and created time properties are now rounded to the nearest minute&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#last-edited-and-created-time-properties-are-now-rounded-to-the-nearest-minute&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Starting July 1st, the &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;last_edited_time&lt;/code&gt; and &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;created_time&lt;/code&gt; properties will be rounded down to the closest minute for &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;page&lt;/code&gt;, &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;database&lt;/code&gt; , and &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;block&lt;/code&gt; objects. Previously, this behavior was inconsistent with some times being rounded and others not.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;h2 class=&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;june-23-2021&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-june-23-2021&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;June 23, 2021&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to June 23, 2021&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#june-23-2021&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;
&lt;h3 class=&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;database-objects-now-return-parent&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-database-objects-now-return-parent&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Database objects now return parent&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Database objects now return parent&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#database-objects-now-return-parent&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Database objects now return a &lt;a href=&quot;/reference/database#page-parent&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;parent property&lt;/a&gt;. Databases can have pages or workspaces as parents.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar&quot; role=&quot;tablist&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=&quot;true&quot; class=&quot;CodeTabs_active&quot; role=&quot;tab&quot; type=&quot;button&quot;&gt;JSON&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-inner&quot; role=&quot;tabpanel&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang-json theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;json&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;{
  &amp;quot;parent&amp;quot;: {
    &amp;quot;type&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;page_id&amp;quot;,
    &amp;quot;page_id&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;b8595b75-abd1-4cad-8dfe-f935a8ef57cb&amp;quot;
}
&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;h3 class=&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;other-improvements-and-fixes&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-other-improvements-and-fixes&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Other Improvements and Fixes&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Other Improvements and Fixes&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#other-improvements-and-fixes&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
&lt;li&gt;Inline database mentions are now included in &lt;a href=&quot;/reference/rich-text#database-mentions&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;rich_text mention&lt;/a&gt; responses.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;When an integration does not have access to a &lt;a href=&quot;/reference/rich-text#page-mentions&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;page or database mention&lt;/a&gt;, we will no longer completely omit the mention. The mention will be returned with just the ID but without detailed information (title will appear as &amp;quot;Untitled&amp;quot; and annotations will be default).&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;When integrations are added to pages inside collections they can now always update page properties, even when the integration does not have access to the parent database. However, integrations will not be able to add new &lt;a href=&quot;/reference/page#select-property-values&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;select&lt;/a&gt; or &lt;a href=&quot;/reference/page#multi-select-property-values&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;multi-select&lt;/a&gt; properties through the create or update page endpoints without the ability to edit the database parent.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;h2 class=&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;june-15-2021&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-june-15-2021&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;June 15, 2021&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to June 15, 2021&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#june-15-2021&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;
&lt;h3 class=&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;select-values-can-now-be-dynamically-created-via-create-and-update-page-endpoints--other-updates-since-public-beta-launch&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-select-values-can-now-be-dynamically-created-via-create-and-update-page-endpoints-other-updates-since-public-beta-launch&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Select values can now be dynamically created via Create and Update Page endpoints + other updates since public beta launch&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Select values can now be dynamically created via Create and Update Page endpoints + other updates since public beta launch&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#select-values-can-now-be-dynamically-created-via-create-and-update-page-endpoints--other-updates-since-public-beta-launch&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
&lt;p&gt;You can now dynamically create new options for &lt;a href=&quot;/reference/database#select-configuration&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Select&lt;/a&gt; or  &lt;a href=&quot;/reference/database#multi-select-configuration&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Multi-Select properties&lt;/a&gt; when using the &lt;a href=&quot;/reference/post-page&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Create Page&lt;/a&gt; and &lt;a href=&quot;/reference/patch-page&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Update Page&lt;/a&gt; endpoints. When specifying an option that does not exist in the database schema already, the option will now be created and the database schema updated accordingly. &lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar&quot; role=&quot;tablist&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=&quot;true&quot; class=&quot;CodeTabs_active&quot; role=&quot;tab&quot; type=&quot;button&quot;&gt;JSON&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-inner&quot; role=&quot;tabpanel&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang-json theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;json&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;{
  &amp;quot;properties&amp;quot;: {
    &amp;quot;Food group&amp;quot;: {
      &amp;quot;multi_select&amp;quot;: [{&amp;quot;name&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Vegetable&amp;quot;},{&amp;quot;name&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Fruit&amp;quot;}]
    }
  }
}
&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p&gt;In the above &lt;a href=&quot;/reference/page-property-value&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;property values&lt;/a&gt; example: Previously, if either &amp;quot;Vegetable&amp;quot; or &amp;quot;Fruit&amp;quot; did not already exist as an option in the database schema, an error would be returned that these are not valid Select options. Now, these options will be created dynamically.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Bug Fixes&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
&lt;li&gt;The title property of a page can be set, and a page can be archived or un-archived, even when the page does not belong to a database.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;/reference/get-page&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Retrieving pages&lt;/a&gt; that are shared with an integration, but where the page&amp;#x27;s parent is not shared, no longer erroneously returns a 404.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Other Changes&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
&lt;li&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;/reference/post-search&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Search endpoint&lt;/a&gt; now returns untitled pages.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;Applies to &lt;a href=&quot;versioning#changes-by-version&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;version 2021-05-13&lt;/a&gt; and later only: The &lt;a href=&quot;/reference/post-database-query&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Query Database&lt;/a&gt; endpoint no longer accepts query parameters ‚Äì these should be sent as body parameters.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;h2 class=&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;may-19-2021&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-may-19-2021&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;May 19, 2021&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to May 19, 2021&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#may-19-2021&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;
&lt;h3 class=&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;notion-version-header-will-be-required-starting-june-1-2021&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-notion-version-header-will-be-required-starting-june-1-2021&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&amp;quot;Notion-Version&amp;quot; header will be required starting June 1, 2021&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to &amp;quot;Notion-Version&amp;quot; header will be required starting June 1, 2021&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#notion-version-header-will-be-required-starting-june-1-2021&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The Notion API has recommended using an explicit version to every HTTP request, using the &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;Notion-Version&lt;/code&gt; header. &lt;strong&gt;For integrations created after June 1, 2021 an explicit version on every request will become required&lt;/strong&gt;. After July 1, 2021, integrations created before June 1, 2021 will also have the same requirement. Today, the most recent version is &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;&amp;quot;2021-05-13&amp;quot;&lt;/code&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;h4 class=&quot;heading heading-4 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;is-my-integration-affected-what-should-i-do-to-update&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-is-my-integration-affected-what-should-i-do-to-update&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Is my integration affected? What should I do to update?&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Is my integration affected? What should I do to update?&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#is-my-integration-affected-what-should-i-do-to-update&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h4&gt;
&lt;p&gt;This requirement will not break your existing integration; however, we will start enforcing this requirement for all API requests on July 1st. Starting July 1st, if you don&amp;#x27;t send the Notion-Version header with your Notion API calls, you will get a &lt;a href=&quot;/reference/errors&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;&amp;quot;missing_version&amp;quot;&lt;/code&gt; error&lt;/a&gt;. Learn more about how the Notion API &lt;a href=&quot;/reference/versioning&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;handles versioning&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;If you&amp;#x27;ve been using examples copied from documentation or example code since the public beta, including using the &lt;a href=&quot;https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;Notion SDK for JavaScript&lt;/a&gt;, your existing code should continue to work as expected.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Otherwise, please make one of the two following changes before July 1:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ol&gt;
&lt;li&gt;Add &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;Notion-Version: 2021-05-11&lt;/code&gt; in the header when making requests (no other code change is needed).&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Recommended&lt;/strong&gt;: Add &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;Notion-Version: 2021-05-13&lt;/code&gt; in the header when making requests.  Making this change will move you to our newest version which includes the following breaking change.&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ol&gt;
&lt;h4 class=&quot;heading heading-4 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;breaking-changes-in-version-2021-05-13&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-breaking-changes-in-version-2021-05-13&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Breaking changes in version &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;2021-05-13&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Breaking changes in version &quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#breaking-changes-in-version-2021-05-13&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h4&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;type&lt;/code&gt; of &lt;a href=&quot;/reference/page-property-value&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;property value objects&lt;/a&gt; for rich text properties has changed from &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;&amp;quot;text&amp;quot;&lt;/code&gt; to &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;&amp;quot;rich_text&amp;quot;&lt;/code&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;When &lt;a href=&quot;/reference/post-page&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;creating pages&lt;/a&gt; and &lt;a href=&quot;/reference/patch-page&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;updating page properties&lt;/a&gt;, update page property values that are rich text to use the key &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;rich_text&lt;/code&gt; instead of &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;text&lt;/code&gt;. Similarly when &lt;a href=&quot;/reference/get-page&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;retrieving a page&lt;/a&gt;, rich text properties will be returned with the &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;type&lt;/code&gt;  &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;&amp;quot;rich_text&amp;quot;&lt;/code&gt; instead of &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;&amp;quot;text&amp;quot;&lt;/code&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;This change helps distinguish between the property type, and the inner text values of &lt;a href=&quot;/reference/rich-text&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;rich text object&lt;/a&gt;, which have the key &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;text&lt;/code&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;To illustrate this change, here is an example of how the &lt;a href=&quot;/reference/page&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;page object&lt;/a&gt;&amp;#x27;s &lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;properties&lt;/code&gt; appear before and after:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar&quot; role=&quot;tablist&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=&quot;true&quot; class=&quot;CodeTabs_active&quot; role=&quot;tab&quot; type=&quot;button&quot;&gt;JavaScript&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-inner&quot; role=&quot;tabpanel&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang-js theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;js&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;// Before (in unversioned requests and responses)
{
  &amp;quot;object&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;page&amp;quot;,
  &amp;quot;properties&amp;quot;: {
    &amp;quot;Description&amp;quot;: {
      &amp;quot;type&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;text&amp;quot;,
      &amp;quot;text&amp;quot;: [
        {
          &amp;quot;type&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;text&amp;quot;,
          &amp;quot;text&amp;quot;: { &amp;quot;content&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Hello World&amp;quot; }
        }
      ]
    }
  }
  /* remaining details omitted */
}
&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar&quot; role=&quot;tablist&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=&quot;true&quot; class=&quot;CodeTabs_active&quot; role=&quot;tab&quot; type=&quot;button&quot;&gt;JavaScript&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;CodeTabs-inner&quot; role=&quot;tabpanel&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=&quot;Copy Code&quot; class=&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=&quot;rdmd-code lang-js theme-light&quot; data-lang=&quot;js&quot; name=&quot;&quot; tabindex=&quot;0&quot;&gt;// After (in requests and responses with version 2021-05-13)
{
  &amp;quot;object&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;page&amp;quot;,
  &amp;quot;properties&amp;quot;: {
    &amp;quot;Description&amp;quot;: {
      &amp;quot;type&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;rich_text&amp;quot;,
      &amp;quot;rich_text&amp;quot;: [
        {
          &amp;quot;type&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;text&amp;quot;,
          &amp;quot;text&amp;quot;: { &amp;quot;content&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Hello World&amp;quot; }
        }
      ]
    }
  }
  /* remaining details omitted */
}
&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;h2 class=&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;may-18-2021&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-may-18-2021&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;May 18, 2021&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to May 18, 2021&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#may-18-2021&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;
&lt;h3 class=&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;initial-users-may-reauthorize-a-public-integration-using-oauth&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-initial-users-may-reauthorize-a-public-integration-using-o-auth&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Initial users may reauthorize a public integration using OAuth&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Initial users may reauthorize a public integration using OAuth&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#initial-users-may-reauthorize-a-public-integration-using-oauth&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Public integrations use OAuth to &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/docs/authorization#prompting-users-to-add-an-integration&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;request authorization from a user&lt;/a&gt; before being added to a Notion workspace. Previously, once an integration was added to a workspace, no users were able to reauthorize the same integration in that workspace. This change allows the user who initially added the integration to complete the authorization flow more than once. This improvement helps integrations avoid a potential dead end in user flows.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Integrations do not need to make any updates to take advantage of this new capability. An integration may simply link or redirect a user to the authorization URL, the same as the first authorization. During reauthorization the user will not see the page picker. The access token received at the end of reauthorization will be the same as the initial access token. This capability is available immediately.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Please be aware that other previous limitations still exist. Only users with admin access level in a workspace can add an integration. Integrations can only be added to a workspace by one user.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;h2 class=&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;may-13-2021&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-may-13-2021&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;May 13, 2021&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to May 13, 2021&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#may-13-2021&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;
&lt;h3 class=&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;hello-world-the-notion-api-is-now-in-public-beta&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-hello-world-the-notion-api-is-now-in-public-beta&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Hello world, the Notion API is now in public beta&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Hello world, the Notion API is now in public beta&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#hello-world-the-notion-api-is-now-in-public-beta&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The Notion API is now available for all developers to explore and build upon. Integrations built on the API are available to all Notion users, on free or paid plans.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;In this public beta release, you&amp;#x27;ll find many of the fundamental parts of Notion: reading and writing to pages, working with users, and the deep and powerful world of Notion databases. The API itself offers foundational features such as authorization, pagination, limits, and more. This is enough to build many interesting integrations we&amp;#x27;ve heard Notion users are excited to use. We&amp;#x27;re excited to see what you&amp;#x27;ll build for all of us. &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/docs/getting-started&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;‚Üí Get started&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Our goal is to establish that the Notion API is robust, easy to use, and trustworthy. In public beta, we‚Äôll continue to add new features and making significant changes based on your feedback. Once the most important improvements are included, the API will transition from public beta to general availability. you‚Äôll have everything you need to build integrations teams and businesses can depend on.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;A special thanks to the all developers who experimented, explored, and shared their ideas with us - both in the private beta and those following along.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;h2 class=&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;may-4-2021&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-may-4-2021&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;May 4, 2021&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to May 4, 2021&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#may-4-2021&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;
&lt;h3 class=&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;public-integration-type-extends-access-to-multiple-workspaces-using-oauth&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-public-integration-type-extends-access-to-multiple-workspaces-using-o-auth&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Public integration type extends access to multiple workspaces using OAuth&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Public integration type extends access to multiple workspaces using OAuth&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#public-integration-type-extends-access-to-multiple-workspaces-using-oauth&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The Notion API has added a new integration type: Public OAuth integrations. If you&amp;#x27;re building a product or service for Notion users outside your own team - public integrations are for developers like you. &lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;In order to create and configure an integration, its type, name, avatar, and other related settings, the &lt;a href=&quot;https://www.notion.com/my-integrations&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;My integrations&lt;/a&gt; page is now available.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Public integrations use OAuth to request permission to access pages and databases in new workspaces. Once the user accepts, the integration can receive a separate access token for resources in the user&amp;#x27;s workspace.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Existing integrations are now known as internal integrations. We no longer call the bearer token you previously used an API Key. It&amp;#x27;s now known as an integration token. You can keep your bearer token around - it will continue to work just the same.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Learn how to implement these changes in the &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/docs/authorization&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;authorization guide&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;h2 class=&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;may-3-2021&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-may-3-2021&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;May 3, 2021&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to May 3, 2021&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#may-3-2021&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;
&lt;h3 class=&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll&quot; align=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint&quot; id=&quot;search-is-now-available-in-the-api&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;heading-text&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=&quot;section-search-is-now-available-in-the-api&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Search is now available in the API&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=&quot;Skip link to Search is now available in the API&quot; class=&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor&quot; href=&quot;#search-is-now-available-in-the-api&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Using the new &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/post-search&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;search endpoint&lt;/a&gt;, you can query all pages and databases users have shared with your integration.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The query you provide filters results by matching against the page title. The results also include matches against subpages of pages users have shared with your integration. This endpoint can be helpful when onboarding a new user and trying to find the page they just shared with your integration.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;We recommend transitioning away from using the &lt;a href=&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/get-databases&quot; target=&quot;&quot; title=&quot;&quot;&gt;list databases endpoint&lt;/a&gt;. The search endpoint provides all the same functionality - and more.&lt;/p&gt;" style="margin-left:31px" class="rm-Markdown markdown-body rm-Markdown markdown-body ng-non-bindable" data-testid="RDMD"><blockquote class="callout callout_info" theme="üìò"><h2 class="callout-heading"><span class="callout-icon">üìò</span><p>View the current <a target="_self" href="/page/changelog">Changelog</a> for the newest updates</p></h2><p>This page is a historical archive of updates older than September 2023. This is kept separate from the current changelog to keep page navigation faster while retaining older updates.</p></blockquote>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="august-23---september-5-2023"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-august-23-september-5-2023" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>August 23 - September 5, 2023</div><a aria-label="Skip link to August 23 - September 5, 2023" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#august-23---september-5-2023"></a></h2>
<ul>
<li>The <a target="_self" href="/docs/working-with-databases">Working with databases guide</a> was revised to improve its readability and to make additional resources easier to find.</li>
<li>Notion&#x27;s <a target="_self" href="https://www.postman.com/notionhq/workspace/notion-s-api-workspace/collection/15568543-d990f9b7-98d3-47d3-9131-4866ab9c6df2">Postman collection</a> for the API was updated. Be sure to pull recent changes into your forked version.</li>
<li>A reminder was added to the <a target="_self" href="/reference/create-a-comment">Comments endpoints</a> to update <a target="_self" href="/reference/capabilities">integration capabilities</a> for comments prior to using the endpoints. (Read/write comment capabilities are off by default and can be turned on in the <a target="_self" href="https://www.notion.so/my-integrations">integration dashboard</a>.)</li>
<li>General clean-up and improvements, including code formatting.</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="august-8---august-22-2023"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-august-8-august-22-2023" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>August 8 - August 22, 2023</div><a aria-label="Skip link to August 8 - August 22, 2023" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#august-8---august-22-2023"></a></h2>
<ul>
<li>The <a target="_self" href="/docs/create-a-notion-integration">Build your first integration</a> guide was rewritten with new demo code to help developers learn how to use Notion‚Äôs API even faster.
<ul>
<li>A new <a target="_self" href="https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js/tree/main/examples/web-form-with-express">sample app</a> was added to the <a target="_self" href="https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js/tree/main">Notion SDK for JavaScript</a> <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">/examples</code> directory. This completed sample app is referenced in the new <a target="_self" href="/docs/create-a-notion-integration">Build your first integration</a> guide.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>The description for the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">block_id</code> path parameter was updated for the <a target="_self" href="/reference/patch-block-children">Append block children</a> endpoint to indicate that a block ID or page ID can be used.</li>
<li>A clarification was added to <a target="_self" href="/reference/retrieve-a-database">documentation</a> for retrieving/updating database properties: If a property is based on a relation to another database, the related database also needs to be shared with the integration.</li>
<li>A clarification was added to documentation for <a target="_self" href="/reference/post-database-query-filter#multi-select">querying databases</a>. When filtering a multi-select property, the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">contains</code> field will filter for exact matches for the string provided.</li>
<li>The <a target="_self" href="/docs/working-with-comments">Working with comments</a> guide was updated with additional examples to distinguish between creating page comments and inline discussion comments.
<ul>
<li>The <a target="_self" href="/reference/create-a-comment">Create a comment</a> endpoint description now links to the Working with comments guide to help developers find additional resources faster.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>If you haven‚Äôt already, join our <a target="_self" href="https://join.slack.com/t/notiondevs/shared_invite/zt-20b5996xv-DzJdLiympy6jP0GGzu3AMg">Notion Devs Slack group</a> to learn from other developers building with the public API.</li>
</ul>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="notice-for-an-upcoming-public-api-change"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-notice-for-an-upcoming-public-api-change" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Notice for an upcoming Public API change</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Notice for an upcoming Public API change" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#notice-for-an-upcoming-public-api-change"></a></h3>
<h4 class="heading heading-4 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="we-will-soon-be-rolling-out-changes-to-the-formulas-property-formulas-20-and-as-such-we-will-be-making-a-change-to-the-notion-public-api"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-we-will-soon-be-rolling-out-changes-to-the-formulas-property-formulas-2-0-and-as-such-we-will-be-making-a-change-to-the-notion-public-api" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>We will soon be rolling out changes to the Formulas property (Formulas 2.0), and as such, we will be making a change to the Notion Public API.</div><a aria-label="Skip link to We will soon be rolling out changes to the Formulas property (Formulas 2.0), and as such, we will be making a change to the Notion Public API." class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#we-will-soon-be-rolling-out-changes-to-the-formulas-property-formulas-20-and-as-such-we-will-be-making-a-change-to-the-notion-public-api"></a></h4>
<p>This is a non-versioned change and is expected to be in effect in the next couple weeks.</p>
<p><strong>tl;dr:</strong> As part of the Formulas 2.0 rollout, the Public API‚Äôs format of the string value for <a target="_self" href="/reference/property-object#formula"><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">formula.expression</code></a> will be changing. Public API calls with formula inputs in the old format will still succeed. On write operations, the old format will be supported indefinitely, but on read, only the new format will be returned. This change is being made to improve the formulas experience and ensure parity with the Notion app. </p>
<p>No action is required for creating or updating database formulas. Reading database <a target="_self" href="/reference/property-object#formula"><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">formula.expression</code></a> values may require developer changes.</p>
<h4 class="heading heading-4 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="what-do-you-need-to-know"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-what-do-you-need-to-know" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>What do you need to know?</div><a aria-label="Skip link to What do you need to know?" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#what-do-you-need-to-know"></a></h4>
<p> <strong>The string value of <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">formula.expression</code> is changing; the schema is not.</strong> </p>
<ul>
<li><strong>On write</strong> via the Public API (<a target="_self" href="/reference/create-a-database">create</a> or <a target="_self" href="/reference/update-a-database">update</a> database endpoints), Notion will support using the old format as a Public API input in the formula property schema indefinitely <em>and</em> will support writing in the <strong>new</strong> format.</li>
<li>Database objects returned via the Public API will have the new formulas 2.0 format.</li>
</ul>
<div class="CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light"><div class="CodeTabs-toolbar" role="tablist"><button aria-selected="true" class="CodeTabs_active" role="tab" type="button">JavaScript</button></div><div class="CodeTabs-inner" role="tabpanel"><pre><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang-javascript theme-light" data-lang="javascript" name="" tabindex="0">// Old format
&quot;Updated price&quot;: {
  &quot;id&quot;: &quot;YU%7C%40&quot;,
  &quot;name&quot;: &quot;Updated price&quot;,
  &quot;type&quot;: &quot;formula&quot;,
  &quot;formula&quot;: {
    &quot;expression&quot;: &quot;prop(\&quot;Price\&quot;) * 2&quot;
  }
}

// New format (upcoming)
&quot;Updated price&quot;: {
  &quot;id&quot;: &quot;YU%7C%40&quot;,
  &quot;name&quot;: &quot;Updated price&quot;,
  &quot;type&quot;: &quot;formula&quot;,
  &quot;formula&quot;: {
      &quot;expression&quot;: &quot;{{notion:block_property:BtVS:00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000:8994905a-074a-415f-9bcf-d1f8b4fa38e4}}/2&quot;
  }
}
</code></pre></div></div>
<h4 class="heading heading-4 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="why-is-this-happening"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-why-is-this-happening" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Why is this happening?</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Why is this happening?" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#why-is-this-happening"></a></h4>
<p>Notion databases allow you to build a fully customizable system for you and your team ‚Äì they provide a place where you can keep all your information in one place, with the ability to build views, filters, and workflows that can be adapted to your needs. </p>
<p>The formula property helps you take that even further ‚Äì allowing you to perform calculations, create specialized views, and provide an extra layer of insight based on information in other database properties. It helps expand what you can do in Notion databases.</p>
<p>We are improving the formulas experience so that: </p>
<ol>
<li>It‚Äôs easier to write formulas.</li>
<li>Formula outputs look and feel more native to Notion.</li>
<li>The formula language can fulfill more specific needs.</li>
</ol>
<p>Changes being made to the API are to ensure parity with the Notion app. </p>
<h4 class="heading heading-4 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="what-do-you-need-to-do"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-what-do-you-need-to-do" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>What do you need to do?</div><a aria-label="Skip link to What do you need to do?" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#what-do-you-need-to-do"></a></h4>
<p>This is a non-versioned change that will not affect most developers. As mentioned, the formula property format will still have the same schema in the Public API; only the value of the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">formula.expression</code> field will change.</p>
<p>Keep an eye on this changelog for when the update becomes available in the Public API.</p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="july-25---august-7-2023"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-july-25-august-7-2023" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>July 25 - August 7, 2023</div><a aria-label="Skip link to July 25 - August 7, 2023" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#july-25---august-7-2023"></a></h2>
<ul>
<li>Notion is excited to announce our <a target="_self" href="https://www.notion.so/technology-partner-program">Technology Partnership Program</a>. üéâ This program is open to companies who have built a public integration (including Link Previews) and are interested in improving and scaling their integration with Notion‚Äôs support. If you think your integration and company could be a fit, <a target="_self" href="https://www.notion.so/technology-partner-program">learn more and apply here</a>.</li>
<li>We‚Äôve updated our API reference docs to include information on Notion‚Äôs <a target="_self" href="https://www.notion.so/help/wikis-and-verified-pages">wiki databases and verified pages</a>. Updates include:
<ul>
<li>An overview on wikis in the guide to <a target="_self" href="/docs/working-with-databases#properties">working with databases</a>.</li>
<li>The <a target="_self" href="/reference/page-property-values#verification"><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">verification</code></a> page property was added to the <a target="_self" href="/reference/page-property-values">Page properties</a> documentation.</li>
<li>The <a target="_self" href="/reference/create-a-database">Create a database</a> and <a target="_self" href="/reference/post-database-query">Query a database</a> endpoint documentation was updated to reflect API changes related to wikis. Namely, that querying wiki databases can return both <a target="_self" href="/reference/page">Page</a> and <a target="_self" href="/reference/database">Database</a> objects.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>The <a target="_self" href="/reference/status-codes#error-codes">Error codes</a> section in the <a target="_self" href="/reference/status-codes">Status code</a> page was updated to include examples of the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">&quot;message&quot;</code> returned with each type of API error, as well as descriptions of the issue each error code represents.</li>
<li>A number of sample cURL commands in our docs were still using an old <a target="_self" href="/reference/versioning">Notion Version</a> in their headers. These have all been updated.</li>
<li>A clarification was added to the <a target="_self" href="/docs/authorization#making-api-requests-with-an-internal-integration">Authorization guide</a> that the <a target="_self" href="/reference/versioning">Notion Version</a> is always required in public API request headers.</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="july-11---july-24-2023"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-july-11-july-24-2023" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>July 11 - July 24, 2023</div><a aria-label="Skip link to July 11 - July 24, 2023" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#july-11---july-24-2023"></a></h2>
<ul>
<li>A new integration <a target="_self" href="https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js/tree/main/examples/parse-text-from-any-block-type">example</a> was added to the Notion SDK for JavaScript repo. This example shows how to get the plain text from any block type currently supported by the public API.</li>
<li>The new unique ID page property was added to the <a target="_self" href="/reference/page-property-values">Page properties</a> documentation. When used, the unique ID (<button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">unique_id</code>) auto-increments for every new page created in a database. An optional prefix can be included that will be applied to the ID values.</li>
</ul>
<figure><span aria-label="The unique ID in a Notion page&#x27;s properties" class="img lightbox closed" role="button" tabindex="0"><span class="lightbox-inner"><img alt="The unique ID in a Notion page&#x27;s properties" loading="lazy" src="https://files.readme.io/c599280-unique_id.png" align="center" class="" width="600px" caption="" height="auto" title=""/></span></span><figcaption><p>The unique ID in a Notion page&#x27;s properties</p></figcaption></figure>
<ul>
<li>Workspace Owners can now see <em>all</em> internal integrations created in a workspace via the <a target="_self" href="https://www.notion.so/my-integrations">integration dashboard</a>. This includes integrations created by themselves and other Workspace Owners. We‚Äôve included this information in our <a target="_self" href="/docs/getting-started#internal-integrations">Getting Started</a> guide.</li>
<li>A <a target="_self" href="https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js">Notion SDK for JavaScript</a> code sample was added to the <a target="_self" href="/reference/create-a-database">Create a database</a> endpoint documentation.</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="june-13---july-10-2023"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-june-13-july-10-2023" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>June 13 - July 10, 2023</div><a aria-label="Skip link to June 13 - July 10, 2023" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#june-13---july-10-2023"></a></h2>
<ul>
<li>We updated our <a target="_self" href="/docs">Getting started guide</a> to help developers who are new to the public API better understand how the API relates to integrations.</li>
<li>The <a target="_self" href="/reference/block#embed">Block object</a> docs were updated with a tip on how to embed Vimeo links in a Notion page via the API.</li>
<li>A new <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">after</code> parameter has been added to the <a target="_self" href="/reference/patch-block-children">Append block children</a> endpoint. Developers can now specific where to append a new block, instead of appending it to the end of a parent block by default.
<div class="CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light"><div class="CodeTabs-toolbar" role="tablist"><button aria-selected="true" class="CodeTabs_active" role="tab" type="button">cURL</button></div><div class="CodeTabs-inner" role="tabpanel"><pre><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang-curl theme-light" data-lang="curl" name="" tabindex="0">curl -X PATCH https://api.notion.com/v1/blocks/16d8004e-5f6a-42a6-9811-51c22ddada12/children \
  -H &#x27;Authorization: Bearer &#x27;&quot;$NOTION_API_KEY&quot;&#x27;&#x27; \
  -H &quot;Content-Type: application/json&quot; \
  -H &quot;Notion-Version: 2022-06-28&quot; \
  --data &#x27;{
    &quot;children&quot;: [
    ...
    }
  ], after: &quot;&lt;block_id_to_append_after&gt;&quot;
}&#x27;
</code></pre></div></div>
</li>
<li>The <a target="_self" href="/docs/authorization">Authorization guide</a> had a clarification added to help developers find the resources they need for <a target="_self" href="/docs/link-previews">Link Preview</a> integrations.</li>
<li>The new <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">public_url</code> property was added to the docs. When a page or database has been shared publicly, the response body will include a <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">public_url</code> value.
<div class="CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light"><div class="CodeTabs-toolbar" role="tablist"><button aria-selected="true" class="CodeTabs_active" role="tab" type="button">JSON</button></div><div class="CodeTabs-inner" role="tabpanel"><pre><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang-json theme-light" data-lang="json" name="" tabindex="0">{
  &quot;object&quot;: &quot;page&quot;,
  &quot;id&quot;: &quot;&lt;id&gt;&quot;,
  &quot;created_time&quot;: &quot;2023-06-02T19:54:00.000Z&quot;,
  &quot;last_edited_time&quot;: &quot;2023-06-02T23:04:00.000Z&quot;,
  &quot;created_by&quot;: { ... },
  &quot;last_edited_by&quot;: { ... },
  &quot;cover&quot;: null,
  &quot;icon&quot;: null,
  &quot;parent&quot;: { ... },
  &quot;archived&quot;: false,
  &quot;properties&quot;: { ... },
  &quot;url&quot;: &quot;&lt;url&gt;&quot;,
  &quot;public_url&quot;: &quot;&lt;public-url&gt;&quot;
} 
</code></pre></div></div>
</li>
<li>The <a target="_self" href="/reference/get-block-children">Retrieve block children</a> endpoint documentation was updated to help developers who are new to the public API better understand the endpoint‚Äôs functionality.</li>
<li>The <a target="_self" href="/reference/retrieve-a-block">Retrieve a block</a> endpoint documentation was updated with some additional information related to working with page content.</li>
<li>The <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">invalid_grant</code> code was added to our <a target="_self" href="/reference/status-codes">Status codes</a> documentation. This code is returned when the authorization grant (e.g. token) provided is invalid. For example, a status code <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">400</code> with an <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">invalid_grant</code> code will be returned when the token provided has expired.</li>
<li>The <a target="_self" href="/reference/rich-text">Rich text</a> documentation was updated with additional information on what rich text is and how the Notion uses it.</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="may-30---june-12-2023"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-may-30-june-12-2023" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>May 30 - June 12, 2023</div><a aria-label="Skip link to May 30 - June 12, 2023" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#may-30---june-12-2023"></a></h2>
<ul>
<li>Our guides and docs related to Link Preview integrations have been updated to help developers find the information they need faster.<br/>
Improvements have been made to the following guides and API reference docs:
<ul>
<li><a target="_self" href="/docs/getting-started">Getting started guide</a></li>
<li><a target="_self" href="/docs/link-previews">Introduction to Link Previews guide</a></li>
<li><a target="_self" href="/docs/build-a-link-preview-integration">Building a Link Preview integration guide</a></li>
<li><a target="_self" href="/reference/unfurl-attribute-object">Unfurl attribute object docs</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>We added more information about the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">plain_text</code> property found in the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">rich_text</code> object. Learn more about rich text in our <a target="_self" href="/reference/rich-text">Rich text object</a> docs.</li>
<li>The docs related to <a target="_self" href="/reference/post-database-query-filter">filtering</a> and <a target="_self" href="/reference/post-database-query-sort">sorting</a> database queries now have more code examples for developers building integrations with the <a target="_self" href="https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js">Notion SDK for JavaScript</a>.</li>
<li>We reorganized the REST API reference navigation bar after removing the ‚ÄúOther‚Äù section to make its child pages easier to find.</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="may-16---may-29-2023"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-may-16-may-29-2023" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>May 16 - May 29, 2023</div><a aria-label="Skip link to May 16 - May 29, 2023" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#may-16---may-29-2023"></a></h2>
<ul>
<li>The <a target="_self" href="/reference/post-database-query">Query a database</a> and <a target="_self" href="/reference/post-database-query-filter">Filter database entries</a> docs were updated with additional code examples of passing single and multiple filters.</li>
<li>The <a target="_self" href="/docs/working-with-comments">Working with comments</a> guide was updated to clarify how to retrieve and add comments using the REST API.</li>
<li>The references docs for <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">rollup</code> <a target="_self" href="/reference/page-property-values#rollup">page properties</a>, as well as the <a target="_self" href="/reference/retrieve-a-page-property">Retrieve a page property</a> and <a target="_self" href="/reference/retrieve-a-page">Retrieve a page</a> endpoints were updated with additional information related to limitations. In cases where a page property ‚Äî like a rollup ‚Äî has more than 25 references, the <a target="_self" href="/reference/retrieve-a-page-property">Retrieve a page property</a> endpoint must be used to receive a complete response.</li>
<li>An outdated Changelog URL now redirects to this Changelog page to help avoid confusion.</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="may-2---may-15-2023"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-may-2-may-15-2023" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>May 2 - May 15, 2023</div><a aria-label="Skip link to May 2 - May 15, 2023" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#may-2---may-15-2023"></a></h2>
<ul>
<li>We added a database schema size recommendation of <strong>50KB</strong> to our docs to help developers manage their database query performance. It is strongly recommended that developers keep their schema size under this number.</li>
<li>The <a target="_self" href="/reference/update-a-database">Update a database</a> page was updated to improve readability. Additional information on how this endpoint differs from related endpoints was also added to help developers better navigate the REST API docs.</li>
<li>The <a target="_self" href="/reference/post-database-query#errors">Query a database</a> page was updated with additional information about the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">filter_properties</code> query parameter.<br/>
When used with the REST API, this query parameter is passed as a string, like so:</li>
</ul>
<pre><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">https://api.notion.com/v1/databases/[database_id]/query?filter_properties=[property_id_1]&amp;filter_properties=[property_id_2]
</code></pre>
<p>When used with the <a target="_self" href="https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js">JavaScript SDK</a>, the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">filter_properties</code> option accepts an array of property ID strings:</p>
<div class="CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light"><div class="CodeTabs-toolbar" role="tablist"><button aria-selected="true" class="CodeTabs_active" role="tab" type="button">JavaScript</button></div><div class="CodeTabs-inner" role="tabpanel"><pre><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang-javascript theme-light" data-lang="javascript" name="" tabindex="0">notion.databases.query({
	database_id: &#x27;databaseID&#x27;,
	filter_properties: [&quot;propertyID1&quot;, &quot;propertyID2&quot;]
})
</code></pre></div></div>
<ul>
<li>Docs that mention the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">redirect_uri</code> ‚Äî a value used with <a target="_self" href="/docs/authorization#what-is-a-public-integration">public integrations</a> ‚Äî were updated to clarify when this value is required. Refer to the <a target="_self" href="/reference/create-a-token">Create a token</a> page for a complete description.</li>
<li>The video block-type was updated on the <a target="_self" href="/reference/block#video">Block Object</a> page to clarify accepted video types. YouTube URLs that contain <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">watch</code> or <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">embed</code> are supported video types.</li>
<li>The <a target="_self" href="/reference/patch-block-children">Append a block</a> page content was reorganized to improve readability.</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="april-18---may-1-2023"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-april-18-may-1-2023" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>April 18 - May 1, 2023</div><a aria-label="Skip link to April 18 - May 1, 2023" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#april-18---may-1-2023"></a></h2>
<ul>
<li>The <a target="_self" href="/docs/build-a-link-preview-integration">Build a Link Preview integration guide</a> was updated to reflect a change regarding how link previews are enabled in the <a target="_self" href="https://www.notion.so/my-integrations">integration dashboard</a>.</li>
<li>The <a target="_self" href="/reference/versioning">versioning page</a> was updated to clarify that the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">Notion-Version</code> header is required in Notion REST API requests.</li>
<li>The <a target="_self" href="/reference/parent-object">parent object page</a> and API reference docs for <a target="_self" href="/reference/create-a-database">database POST requests</a> and <a target="_self" href="/reference/patch-block-children">blocks PATCH requests</a> were updated to better explain how parenting rules work.</li>
<li>The <a target="_self" href="/docs/create-a-notion-integration">Integration guide</a> was updated with more links to help developers find resources faster.</li>
<li>Number database properties now support the Peruvian sol as a currency format. To use it, set¬†<button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">&quot;peruvian_sol&quot;</code>¬†as the value for a number‚Äôs¬†<button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">format</code>¬†field when creating or updating a database¬†property¬†or¬†<a target="_self" href="/reference/property-schema-object#number-configuration">schema</a>.</li>
<li>General docs housekeeping, such reducing the number of callouts in our API reference docs to improve the readability.</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="march-14---april-17-2023"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-march-14-april-17-2023" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>March 14 - April 17, 2023</div><a aria-label="Skip link to March 14 - April 17, 2023" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#march-14---april-17-2023"></a></h2>
<ul>
<li>Our developer community Slack invite link was updated. <a target="_self" href="https://join.slack.com/t/notiondevs/shared_invite/zt-1tjam81wh-BGaZXHUY83DpLNjZwKEiGg">Join here</a> to connect with other developers building with the Notion API.</li>
<li>The <a target="_self" href="/docs/authorization">Authorization guide</a> was updated to include more information on creating integrations, adding templates to public integrations, and more code examples to get you started, faster.</li>
<li>We‚Äôve added more code examples to our API reference docs, including <a target="_self" href="/reference/archive-a-page">Archive a page</a> and <a target="_self" href="/reference/authentication">Authentication</a>.</li>
<li>General docs housekeeping, such reducing the number of callouts in our API reference docs to improve the readability.</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="february-28---march-13-2023"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-february-28-march-13-2023" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>February 28 - March 13, 2023</div><a aria-label="Skip link to February 28 - March 13, 2023" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#february-28---march-13-2023"></a></h2>
<p>We don‚Äôt have any changes to announce this week! Stay tuned, and in the meantime check out our platform roadmap for a look at what we‚Äôre building. </p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="february-14---27-2023"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-february-14-27-2023" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>February 14 - 27, 2023</div><a aria-label="Skip link to February 14 - 27, 2023" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#february-14---27-2023"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="fixes-and-improvements"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-fixes-and-improvements" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Fixes and improvements</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Fixes and improvements" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#fixes-and-improvements"></a></h3>
<ul>
<li>You can now update <a target="_self" href="/reference/property-object#rollup">rollup database properties</a> via the API. To programmatically update a <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">rollup</code> property, send a PATCH to <a target="_self" href="/reference/update-a-database">Update a database</a> that specifies the change in the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">properties</code> body param.</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="january-31---february-13-2023"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-january-31-february-13-2023" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>January 31 - February 13, 2023</div><a aria-label="Skip link to January 31 - February 13, 2023" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#january-31---february-13-2023"></a></h2>
<p>We don‚Äôt have any updates to share right now. Stay tuned for the next changelog! To get a sense for what we‚Äôre heads down working on, check out the <a target="_self" href="/page/notion-platform-roadmap#updated-march-2-2022">platform roadmap</a>.</p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="january-18---30-2023"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-january-18-30-2023" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>January 18 - 30, 2023</div><a aria-label="Skip link to January 18 - 30, 2023" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#january-18---30-2023"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="fixes-and-improvements-1"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-fixes-and-improvements" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Fixes and improvements</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Fixes and improvements" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#fixes-and-improvements-1"></a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Stay tuned!</li>
</ul>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="new-things"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-new-things" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>New things</div><a aria-label="Skip link to New things" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#new-things"></a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Added a token <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">Refresh</code> button to the settings page for internal integrations. Click <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">Refresh</code> to generate a new token for your internal integration.</li>
</ul>
<figure><span aria-label="1055" class="img lightbox closed" role="button" tabindex="0"><span class="lightbox-inner"><img alt="1055" loading="lazy" src="https://files.readme.io/b1d6c0c-2023-01-13_10.58.16.gif" title="2023-01-13 10.58.16.gif" align="center" class="" width="80%" caption="" height="auto"/></span></span><figcaption><p>You can now refresh an internal integration token from the integration settings page.</p></figcaption></figure>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="january-3---17-2023"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-january-3-17-2023" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>January 3 - 17, 2023</div><a aria-label="Skip link to January 3 - 17, 2023" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#january-3---17-2023"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="new-things-1"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-new-things" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>New things</div><a aria-label="Skip link to New things" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#new-things-1"></a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Shipped detailed docs for Link Previews including an <a target="_self" href="/docs/link-previews">overview</a>, <a target="_self" href="/docs/build-a-link-preview-integration">getting started guide</a>, and <a target="_self" href="/reference/unfurl-attribute-object">reference materials</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="december-19-2022---january-2-2023"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-december-19-2022-january-2-2023" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>December 19, 2022 - January 2, 2023</div><a aria-label="Skip link to December 19, 2022 - January 2, 2023" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#december-19-2022---january-2-2023"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="fixes-and-improvements-2"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-fixes-and-improvements" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Fixes and improvements</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Fixes and improvements" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#fixes-and-improvements-2"></a></h3>
<ul>
<li>The <a target="_self" href="/reference/retrieve-a-page#errors">Retrieve a Page endpoint</a> can now return specific page property values when you include the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">filter_properties</code> path param.</li>
<li>You can now request specific page property values from a database by passing <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">filter_properties</code> in the request body to the <a target="_self" href="/reference/post-database-query">Query a database endpoint</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="new-things-2"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-new-things" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>New things</div><a aria-label="Skip link to New things" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#new-things-2"></a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Happy 2023! For a sneak peek of what we‚Äôll be up to this year, check out our updated <a target="_self" href="/page/notion-platform-roadmap">platform roadmap</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="december-6---18-2022"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-december-6-18-2022" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>December 6 - 18, 2022</div><a aria-label="Skip link to December 6 - 18, 2022" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#december-6---18-2022"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="fixes-and-improvements-3"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-fixes-and-improvements" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Fixes and improvements</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Fixes and improvements" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#fixes-and-improvements-3"></a></h3>
<ul>
