<li>Updated the¬†<a target="_self" href="/reference/patch-block-children">Append block children</a>¬†and¬†<a target="_self" href="/reference/get-block-children">Retrieve block children</a>¬†endpoints to specific supported block types to create a more consistent dev experience. The endpoints now throw an error if the block type in the request does not <a target="_self" href="/reference/block#block-types-that-support-children">support children</a>. </li>
</ul>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="new-things-3"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-new-things" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>New things</div><a aria-label="Skip link to New things" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#new-things-3"></a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Built a ‚ú®Glitch ‚ú®¬†demo that updates Notion tasks when a linked GitHub PR is closed or merged. <a target="_self" href="https://glitch.com/~notion-task-github-pr-sync">Give it a spin!</a></li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="november-22---december-5-2022"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-november-22-december-5-2022" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>November 22 - December 5, 2022</div><a aria-label="Skip link to November 22 - December 5, 2022" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#november-22---december-5-2022"></a></h2>
<p>We took advantage of the US Thanksgiving holiday to host a mini internal hackathon. </p>
<p>Nothing to share from that, yet! It‚Äôs been a quiet few weeks. </p>
<p>If you want something to read while you stay tuned for the next update, check out the revised <a target="_self" href="/docs/getting-started">Get started</a> guide.</p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="november-8---21-2022"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-november-8-21-2022" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>November 8 - 21, 2022</div><a aria-label="Skip link to November 8 - 21, 2022" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#november-8---21-2022"></a></h2>
<ul>
<li>We added a <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">this_week</code> filter for database queries. You can now search for database entries where the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">&quot;date&quot;</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">&quot;created_time&quot;</code>, or <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">&quot;last_edited_time&quot;</code> property value falls within the current week. Refer to the <a target="_self" href="/reference/post-database-query-filter#date-filter-condition">date filter condition</a> docs for details.</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="october-25---november-7-2022"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-october-25-november-7-2022" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>October 25 - November 7, 2022</div><a aria-label="Skip link to October 25 - November 7, 2022" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#october-25---november-7-2022"></a></h2>
<ul>
<li>Number database properties now support the Singapore dollar as a currency format. To use it, set <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">&quot;singapore_dollar&quot;</code> as the value for a number‚Äôs <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">format</code> field when creating or updating a database <a target="_self" href="/reference/property-object#number-configuration">property</a> or <a target="_self" href="/reference/property-schema-object#number-configuration">schema</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="october-11---24-2022"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-october-11-24-2022" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>October 11 - 24, 2022</div><a aria-label="Skip link to October 11 - 24, 2022" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#october-11---24-2022"></a></h2>
<ul>
<li>You can now add a Notion template option to a public integration from the <a target="_self" href="https://www.notion.so/my-integrations">integration‚Äôs settings page</a>. For details on what the permissions flow looks like for users who opt in to the template, refer to the <a target="_self" href="/docs/authorization#permissions-flow-for-integrations-with-a-notion-template-option">Authorization guide</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="september-26---october-10-2022"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-september-26-october-10-2022" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>September 26 - October 10, 2022</div><a aria-label="Skip link to September 26 - October 10, 2022" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#september-26---october-10-2022"></a></h2>
<ul>
<li>A <a target="_self" href="/reference/property-value-object#relation-property-values"><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">relation</code></a> property value now includes a <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">has_more</code> property when returned by the <a target="_self" href="/reference/retrieve-a-page">Retrieve a page endpoint</a>. <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">has_more</code> is <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">true</code> if the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">relation</code> has more than 25 page references. Otherwise, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">has_more</code> is <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">false</code>.</li>
<li>We added a <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">workspace_name</code> property to <a target="_self" href="/reference/user#bots">bot user objects</a>. If the bot ¬†<button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">owner.type</code> is <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">&quot;workspace&quot;</code>, then¬†<button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">workspace.name</code> identifies the name of the workspace that owns the bot. If the¬†<button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">owner.type</code> is¬†<button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">&quot;user&quot;</code>, then¬†<button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">workspace.name</code> is¬†<button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">null</code>.</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="september-12---25-2022"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-september-12-25-2022" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>September 12 - 25, 2022</div><a aria-label="Skip link to September 12 - 25, 2022" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#september-12---25-2022"></a></h2>
<p>Started an experiment to improve <a target="_self" href="/reference/post-search">search endpoint</a> performance by tweaking how we call Elasticsearch under the hood.</p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="august-29---september-11-2022"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-august-29-september-11-2022" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>August 29 - September 11, 2022</div><a aria-label="Skip link to August 29 - September 11, 2022" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#august-29---september-11-2022"></a></h2>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a bug where date mentions ended in a <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">‚Üí</code> character even if they only represented a single date, not a date range.</li>
<li>Added an <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">Authorization URL</code> field to the public integration form. You can now click to copy the URL that allows users to authorize your integration (read more in the <a target="_self" href="/docs/authorization#prompting-users-to-add-an-integration">Authorization guide</a>). </li>
<li>Corrected an error that caused the <a target="_self" href="/reference/retrieve-a-page-property"><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">getProperty</code> endpoint</a> to return only one item if the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">property_id</code> belonged to a multi-item <a target="_self" href="/reference/property-item-object#files-property-values"><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">Files</code></a> page property.</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="august-31-2022"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-august-31-2022" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>August 31, 2022</div><a aria-label="Skip link to August 31, 2022" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#august-31-2022"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="version-2022-06-28-includes-page-property-types-and-values"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-version-2022-06-28-includes-page-property-types-and-values" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Version 2022-06-28 includes page property types and values</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Version 2022-06-28 includes page property types and values" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#version-2022-06-28-includes-page-property-types-and-values"></a></h3>
<p>Responses for page retrievals, database queries, and searches will again include page property types and values. This matches the behavior in version <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">2022-02-22</code> and takes effect on August 31, 2022.</p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="august-15---28-2022"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-august-15-28-2022" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>August 15 - 28, 2022</div><a aria-label="Skip link to August 15 - 28, 2022" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#august-15---28-2022"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="features"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-features" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Features</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Features" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#features"></a></h3>
<ul>
<li>
<p>The public API now supports the following functionality for <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">status</code> properties:</p>
<ul>
<li>Reading and updating <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">status</code> properties on pages (<a target="_self" href="/reference/property-value-object#status-property-values">read more</a>)</li>
<li>Reading, but not updating, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">status</code> property configuration on databases (<a target="_self" href="/reference/property-object#status-configuration">read more</a>)</li>
<li>Filtering or sorting by <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">status</code> properties when querying databases (<a target="_self" href="/reference/post-database-query-filter#status-filter-condition">read more</a>)</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">header_1</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">header_2</code>, and <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">header_3</code> blocks now have an <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">is_toggleable</code> property, to better indicate whether they are heading toggle blocks. (<a target="_self" href="/reference/block#heading-one-blocks">read more</a>)</p>
<ul>
<li>Headings can be togglified and un-togglified by setting <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">is_toggleable</code> to true or false, but note that all the children inside the toggle must be removed before it can be untogglified.</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="august-1---14-2022"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-august-1-14-2022" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>August 1 - 14, 2022</div><a aria-label="Skip link to August 1 - 14, 2022" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#august-1---14-2022"></a></h2>
<p>No updates for these past two weeks, but stay tuned for the next changelog!</p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="july-18---july-31-2022"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-july-18-july-31-2022" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>July 18 - July 31, 2022</div><a aria-label="Skip link to July 18 - July 31, 2022" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#july-18---july-31-2022"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="features-1"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-features" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Features</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Features" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#features-1"></a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Added support for <a target="_self" href="/reference/retrieve-a-comment">reading</a> and <a target="_self" href="/reference/create-a-comment">writing</a> page-level comments in the API.</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="july-19-2022"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-july-19-2022" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>July 19, 2022</div><a aria-label="Skip link to July 19, 2022" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#july-19-2022"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="comments-api"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-comments-api" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Comments API</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Comments API" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#comments-api"></a></h3>
<p>Today we&#x27;re launching a brand new set of APIs for interacting with Notion comments. This includes the ability to:</p>
<ul>
<li>Read comments from a page or block.</li>
<li>Add a comment to a page.</li>
<li>Add a comment to an existing discussion thread on a block.</li>
</ul>
<p>For more information, check out the new <a target="_self" href="/docs/working-with-comments">guide</a> or dive straight into the <a target="_self" href="/reference/create-a-comment">API reference</a>.</p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="july-5---17-2022"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-july-5-17-2022" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>July 5 - 17, 2022</div><a aria-label="Skip link to July 5 - 17, 2022" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#july-5---17-2022"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="features-2"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-features" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Features</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Features" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#features-2"></a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Released a new version of the API, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">2022-06-28</code>. Previous versions of the API are still supported. Read more about the new version <a target="_self" href="/changelog/releasing-notion-version-2022-06-28">here</a>.</li>
<li>Created a new template repository for getting started with the Notion API and the official SDK. <a target="_self" href="https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-typescript-starter">Find it here.</a></li>
</ul>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="bug-fixes-and-performance-improvements"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-bug-fixes-and-performance-improvements" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Bug fixes and performance improvements</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Bug fixes and performance improvements" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#bug-fixes-and-performance-improvements"></a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Exported many more named types for API response objects in the <a target="_self" href="https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js">official SDK</a>.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug in the official SDK where some API requests would not work due a capitalization issue. (This was a community-submitted PR; thank you @dvanoni!)</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="july-6-2022"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-july-6-2022" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>July 6, 2022</div><a aria-label="Skip link to July 6, 2022" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#july-6-2022"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="releasing-notion-version-2022-06-28"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-releasing-notion-version-2022-06-28" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Releasing Notion-Version 2022-06-28</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Releasing Notion-Version 2022-06-28" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#releasing-notion-version-2022-06-28"></a></h3>
<p><strong>Update from August 31, 2022</strong>: Page properties can now be retrieved using the page, query database, and search endpoints, in addition to the page properties endpoint.</p>
<p>Today we‚Äôre releasing Notion-Version <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">2022-06-28</code> with the following backwards incompatible changes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Page properties must be retrieved using the page properties endpoint.</li>
<li>Parents are now always direct parents; a parent field has been added to block.</li>
<li>Database relations have a type of <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">single_property</code> and <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">dual_property</code>.</li>
</ul>
<p>Read more about each of these changes below.</p>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="page-properties-must-be-retrieved-using-the-page-properties-endpoint"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-page-properties-must-be-retrieved-using-the-page-properties-endpoint" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Page properties must be retrieved using the page properties endpoint</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Page properties must be retrieved using the page properties endpoint" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#page-properties-must-be-retrieved-using-the-page-properties-endpoint"></a></h3>
<p>Previously, the <a target="_self" href="/reference/page">page object</a> returned from page endpoints, as well as the query database and search endpoint, returned a <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">properties</code> field that contained all the page‚Äôs properties along with its value:</p>
<div class="CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light"><div class="CodeTabs-toolbar" role="tablist"><button aria-selected="true" class="CodeTabs_active" role="tab" type="button">Previous Version Response</button></div><div class="CodeTabs-inner" role="tabpanel"><pre><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang-json theme-light" data-lang="json" name="Previous Version Response" tabindex="0">&quot;properties&quot;: {
    &quot;Name&quot;: {
      &quot;id&quot;: &quot;title&quot;,
      &quot;type&quot;: &quot;title&quot;,
      &quot;title&quot;: [
        {
          &quot;type&quot;: &quot;text&quot;,
          &quot;text&quot;: {
            &quot;content&quot;: &quot;Avocado&quot;,
            &quot;link&quot;: null
          },
          &quot;annotations&quot;: {
            &quot;bold&quot;: false,
            &quot;italic&quot;: false,
            &quot;strikethrough&quot;: false,
            &quot;underline&quot;: false,
            &quot;code&quot;: false,
            &quot;color&quot;: &quot;default&quot;
          },
          &quot;plain_text&quot;: &quot;Avocado&quot;,
          &quot;href&quot;: null
        }
      ]
   }
}
</code></pre></div></div>
<p>While convenient, returning accurate results for all properties resulted in bad performance and timeouts for larger databases or pages with lots of mentions. To combat performance, on March 1st, we <a target="_self" href="/reference/property-value-object">added a disclaimer</a> that page objects stopped returning accurate results for pages with more than 25 mentions to other objects (which affected properties of type <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">title</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">rich_text</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">relation</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">people</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">rollup</code>, and <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">formula</code>).</p>
<p>In October 2021, <a target="_self" href="/changelog/retrieve-page-property-values">we introduced</a> a way to more accurately retrieve individual page properties via the <a target="_self" href="/reference/retrieve-a-page-property">retrieve a page property item endpoint</a>. With this endpoint, we‚Äôre able to paginate complex properties that involve additional look-ups.</p>
<p>With version <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">2022-06-28</code>, the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">type</code> and <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">property</code> value from page objects are removed. Thus moving forward, all property value retrieval must happen through the retrieve a page property item endpoint.</p>
<div class="CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light"><div class="CodeTabs-toolbar" role="tablist"><button aria-selected="true" class="CodeTabs_active" role="tab" type="button">New Version Response</button></div><div class="CodeTabs-inner" role="tabpanel"><pre><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang-json theme-light" data-lang="json" name="New Version Response" tabindex="0">&quot;properties&quot;: {
    &quot;Name&quot;: {
      &quot;id&quot;: &quot;title&quot;
   }
}
</code></pre></div></div>
<p>For more examples of how to use the retrieve a page property item endpoint, our <a target="_self" href="/page/examples">SDK examples</a> have been updated to use the retrieve a page property item endpoint.</p>
<p>For more details about why page properties are so complex, we wrote about it in our <a target="_self" href="https://www.notion.so/blog/creating-the-notion-api">‚ÄúCreating the Notion API‚Äù</a> blog post.</p>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="parents-are-now-always-direct-parents-a-parent-field-has-been-added-to-block"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-parents-are-now-always-direct-parents-a-parent-field-has-been-added-to-block" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Parents are now always direct parents; a parent field has been added to block</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Parents are now always direct parents; a parent field has been added to block" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#parents-are-now-always-direct-parents-a-parent-field-has-been-added-to-block"></a></h3>
<p>Previously, when accessing the parent of a database or page, that parent was always either a page, database, or workspace. This is un-faithful to the actual data model of Notion, where the parent may also be another block; for example, you can nest a page under a toggle block.</p>
<p>The parent field for page and database has been changed so that it is now always the direct parent of that page or database, and a new parent type has been added: <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">block_id</code>.</p>
<p>Additionally, a <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">parent</code> field has been added to the block object. Together, these changes allow you to fully traverse Notion‚Äôs tree.</p>
<p>To emulate the previous behavior of retrieving the page, database, or space parent, you may traverse up the tree using the retrieve a block endpoint. If the parent ‚â† one of those types, retrieve the parent block until it is.</p>
<p>Read more about parent types <a target="_self" href="/reference/parent-object">here</a>.</p>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="database-relations-have-a-type-of-single_property-and-dual_property"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-database-relations-have-a-type-of-single-property-and-dual-property" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Database relations have a type of <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">single_property</code> and <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">dual_property</code></div><a aria-label="Skip link to Database relations have a type of " class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#database-relations-have-a-type-of-single_property-and-dual_property"></a></h3>
<p>Relation properties in databases objects now have a type of <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">single_property</code> or <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">dual_property</code>. These can be used to create one way relations between databases as well as two way relations within a database.</p>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="new-version-of-the-javascript-sdk"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-new-version-of-the-java-script-sdk" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>New version of the JavaScript SDK</div><a aria-label="Skip link to New version of the JavaScript SDK" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#new-version-of-the-javascript-sdk"></a></h3>
<p>Coinciding with all of these changes, we&#x27;ve released a new major version (v2.0.0) of the <a target="_self" href="https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js">Notion JavaScript SDK</a>. To upgrade to this new version, run <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">npm install @notionhq/client@latest</code> or <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">yarn upgrade --latest @notionhq/client</code> from within your repository.</p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="june-20---july-4-2022"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-june-20-july-4-2022" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>June 20 - July 4, 2022</div><a aria-label="Skip link to June 20 - July 4, 2022" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#june-20---july-4-2022"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="features-3"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-features" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Features</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Features" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#features-3"></a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Added limited readonly support for database status properties. Read more about status properties <a target="_self" href="https://www.notion.so/help/guides/status-property-gives-clarity-on-tasks">here</a>.
<ul>
<li>Status property values are returned in the <a target="_self" href="/reference/retrieve-a-page">Retrieve a page</a> endpoint. See <a target="_self" href="/reference/property-value-object">Property values</a> for more information.</li>
<li>Status property configuration is not supported yet. See <a target="_self" href="/reference/property-object">Property object</a> for more information.</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="bug-fixes"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-bug-fixes" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Bug Fixes</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Bug Fixes" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#bug-fixes"></a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Added a validation for adding new rollup properties that prevents creating a rollup of another rollup.</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="june-6---june-19-2022"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-june-6-june-19-2022" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>June 6 - June 19, 2022</div><a aria-label="Skip link to June 6 - June 19, 2022" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#june-6---june-19-2022"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="features-4"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-features" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Features</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Features" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#features-4"></a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Added support for creating inline databases with <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">is_inline</code>. Read more <a target="_self" href="/reference/database">here</a>.</li>
<li>Added support for reading and writing database descriptions with the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">description</code> field. Read more <a target="_self" href="/reference/database">here</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="may-23---june-5-2022"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-may-23-june-5-2022" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>May 23 - June 5, 2022</div><a aria-label="Skip link to May 23 - June 5, 2022" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#may-23---june-5-2022"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="bug-fixes-and-performance-improvements-1"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-bug-fixes-and-performance-improvements" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Bug fixes and performance improvements</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Bug fixes and performance improvements" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#bug-fixes-and-performance-improvements-1"></a></h3>
<ul>
<li>The public API once again supports inline<button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">mailto</code> links in rich text.</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="may-9---22-2022"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-may-9-22-2022" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>May 9 - 22, 2022</div><a aria-label="Skip link to May 9 - 22, 2022" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#may-9---22-2022"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="bug-fixes-and-performance-improvements-2"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-bug-fixes-and-performance-improvements" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Bug fixes and performance improvements</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Bug fixes and performance improvements" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#bug-fixes-and-performance-improvements-2"></a></h3>
<ul>
<li>We now validate URLs used to create inline text links in the public API. For more details on inline links in rich text, see the <a target="_self" href="/reference/rich-text">Rich text object</a> documentation. </li>
<li>The <a target="_self" href="/reference/post-search">Search</a> endpoint now returns fuzzier matches, including plurals and different verb tenses. This corresponds to fuzzier matches while searching in the Notion app and should result in more search results overall for any given query.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug where the integration page at <a target="_self" href="https://www.notion.so/my-integrations">https://www.notion.so/my-integrations</a> wouldn&#x27;t load.</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="may-10-2022"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-may-10-2022" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>May 10, 2022</div><a aria-label="Skip link to May 10, 2022" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#may-10-2022"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="link-preview-apis"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-link-preview-ap-is" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Link Preview APIs</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Link Preview APIs" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#link-preview-apis"></a></h3>
<p>Today we‚Äôre excited to launch a new set of APIs for developers to build on ‚Äî Link Preview APIs. Over the past six months, we launched link previews with tools like Slack, Trello, Figma, and Asana, allowing users to preview authenticated content in a new structured block. Now, we‚Äôre ready for any developer to build integrations that support link previews in Notion.</p>
<p>We built link previews to make it easy for users to easily share information in one place using a link. But with a regular link, the information would become automatically stale, making it difficult to share the latest updates among teams. Now, with the new link previews APIs, Notion will let you know when a user pastes a link to a domain you own, let the user authenticate with Notion and your service, and let you unfurl a new link preview block inside Notion.</p>
<p>Learn more about the new link previews APIs <a target="_self" href="/page/link-previews-api">here</a>, and apply to get access to and build your integration by filling out <a target="_self" href="https://notionup.typeform.com/to/BXheLK4Z?typeform-source=developers.notion.com">this form</a>.</p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="april-25---may-9-2022"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-april-25-may-9-2022" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>April 25 - May 9, 2022</div><a aria-label="Skip link to April 25 - May 9, 2022" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#april-25---may-9-2022"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="bug-fixes-and-performance-improvements-3"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-bug-fixes-and-performance-improvements" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Bug fixes and performance improvements</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Bug fixes and performance improvements" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#bug-fixes-and-performance-improvements-3"></a></h3>
<ul>
<li>We&#x27;ve shipped a couple of improvements under the hood to make the search and query database endpoints faster. We&#x27;re actively looking into 500s and timeouts on the query database endpoint in particular.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug in the OAuth page picker where Shared pages wouldn&#x27;t load until the workspace switcher was clicked</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="april-11---24-2022"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-april-11-24-2022" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>April 11 - 24, 2022</div><a aria-label="Skip link to April 11 - 24, 2022" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#april-11---24-2022"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="bug-fixes-and-performance-improvements-4"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-bug-fixes-and-performance-improvements" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Bug fixes and performance improvements</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Bug fixes and performance improvements" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#bug-fixes-and-performance-improvements-4"></a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a bug where some rollups and relations appeared empty when they shouldn&#x27;t have.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug in the query database endpoint where an invalid pagination cursor was being returned.</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="march-28---april-10-2022"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-march-28-april-10-2022" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>March 28 - April 10, 2022</div><a aria-label="Skip link to March 28 - April 10, 2022" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#march-28---april-10-2022"></a></h2>
<p>There was a <a target="_self" href="https://www.notion.so/releases">company-wide product bug bash</a>! As a result nothing API-specific to share for these 2 weeks, but we&#x27;ve been hard at work improving test coverage and paring down tech debt.</p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="march-14---27-2022"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-march-14-27-2022" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>March 14 - 27, 2022</div><a aria-label="Skip link to March 14 - 27, 2022" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#march-14---27-2022"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="features-5"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-features" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Features</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Features" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#features-5"></a></h3>
<ul>
<li>You can now filter databases on the created at and last edited at timestamps, even if they don&#x27;t have a corresponding property of that type. Read more <a target="_self" href="/reference/post-database-query-filter#timestamp-filter-object">here</a>.</li>
<li>A <a target="_self" href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Retry-After"><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">Retry-After</code></a> response header is now being sent with rate limited request responses. The value of this field is set as an integer number of seconds (in decimal). Requests made after waiting this minimum amount of time should not be rate limited. Read more about our rate limits <a target="_self" href="/reference/request-limits#rate-limits">here</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="bug-fixes-and-performance-improvements-5"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-bug-fixes-and-performance-improvements" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Bug fixes and performance improvements</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Bug fixes and performance improvements" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#bug-fixes-and-performance-improvements-5"></a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Stopped throwing an error when rendering property formulas that hadn&#x27;t been set up yet in the <a target="_self" href="/reference/retrieve-a-page-property">Retrieve a page property item</a> endpoint. These formulas now return <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">null</code> values.</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="march-18-2022"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-march-18-2022" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>March 18, 2022</div><a aria-label="Skip link to March 18, 2022" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#march-18-2022"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="query-a-database-endpoint-supports-filtering-by-timestamp"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-query-a-database-endpoint-supports-filtering-by-timestamp" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Query a database endpoint supports filtering by timestamp</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Query a database endpoint supports filtering by timestamp" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#query-a-database-endpoint-supports-filtering-by-timestamp"></a></h3>
<p>When <a target="_self" href="/reference/post-database-query">querying a database</a> using filters, you previously were only able to build filters using properties that were explicitly defined in the database schema. We&#x27;ve added a new type of filter for the created timestamp and last edited timestamp of any page within the database. This means you can filter by these attributes, even if the database doesn&#x27;t have a &quot;Created time&quot; or &quot;Last edited time&quot; <em>property</em>.</p>
<p>You can read more about this filter type <a target="_self" href="/reference/post-database-query-filter#timestamp-filter-object">here</a>, but as a preview here is how you would filter by the created timestamp:</p>
<div class="CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light"><div class="CodeTabs-toolbar" role="tablist"><button aria-selected="true" class="CodeTabs_active" role="tab" type="button">JSON</button></div><div class="CodeTabs-inner" role="tabpanel"><pre><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang-json theme-light" data-lang="json" name="" tabindex="0">{
    &quot;filter&quot;: {
        &quot;timestamp&quot;: &quot;created_time&quot;,
        &quot;created_time&quot;: {
          &quot;past_week&quot;: {}
        }
    }
}
</code></pre></div></div>
<p>And here&#x27;s how you would filter by the last edited time:</p>
<div class="CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light"><div class="CodeTabs-toolbar" role="tablist"><button aria-selected="true" class="CodeTabs_active" role="tab" type="button">JSON</button></div><div class="CodeTabs-inner" role="tabpanel"><pre><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang-json theme-light" data-lang="json" name="" tabindex="0">{
    &quot;filter&quot;: {
        &quot;timestamp&quot;: &quot;last_edited_time&quot;,
        &quot;last_edited_time&quot;: {
          &quot;after&quot;: &quot;2021-05-10&quot;
        }
    }
}
</code></pre></div></div>
<p>Note that you can also use this filter type within a compound filter.</p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="february-28-2022---march-13-2022"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-february-28-2022-march-13-2022" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>February 28, 2022 - March 13, 2022</div><a aria-label="Skip link to February 28, 2022 - March 13, 2022" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#february-28-2022---march-13-2022"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="features-6"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-features" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Features</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Features" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#features-6"></a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Block colors are now supported in the API! Read more about it <a target="_self" href="/changelog/block-colors-are-now-supported-in-the-api">here</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="bug-fixes-and-performance-improvements-6"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-bug-fixes-and-performance-improvements" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Bug fixes and performance improvements</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Bug fixes and performance improvements" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#bug-fixes-and-performance-improvements-6"></a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Rich text objects now properly include template mentions. Read more about this type of text object <a target="_self" href="/reference/rich-text#template-mentions">here</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="march-8-2022"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-march-8-2022" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>March 8, 2022</div><a aria-label="Skip link to March 8, 2022" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#march-8-2022"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="block-colors-are-now-supported-in-the-api"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-block-colors-are-now-supported-in-the-api" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Block colors are now supported in the API</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Block colors are now supported in the API" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#block-colors-are-now-supported-in-the-api"></a></h3>
<p>We have added support for block colors in the Notion Public API. There is now a <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">color</code> keyword for the following block types: <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">paragraph</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">heading_1</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">heading_2</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">heading_3</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">bulleted_list_item</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">numbered_list_item</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">to_do</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">toggle</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">callout</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">quote</code>, and <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">table_of_contents</code>. For these block types, the block color is returned in the <a target="_self" href="/reference/block">block object</a>, and you can use the <a target="_self" href="/reference/update-a-block">update block</a>, <a target="_self" href="/reference/append-block-children">append block children</a>, and <a target="_self" href="/reference/post-page">create page</a> endpoints to update the color of existing blocks and create new blocks with color.</p>
<p>The colors supported are <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">default</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">gray</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">brown</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">orange</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" <h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="march-7-2022"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-march-7-2022" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>March 7, 2022</div><a aria-label="Skip link to March 7, 2022" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#march-7-2022"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="updated-developers-terms"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-updated-developers-terms" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Updated Developers Terms</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Updated Developers Terms" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#updated-developers-terms"></a></h3>
<p>With the API officially out of beta, Notion has updated our developer terms of service as of March 1st, 2022. View our updated terms <a target="_self" href="https://www.notion.so/notion/Developer-Terms-ba4131408d0844e08330da2cbb225c20">here</a>.</p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="february-14-2022---28-2022-block-by-block-edition"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-february-14-2022-28-2022-block-by-block-edition" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>February 14, 2022 - 28, 2022: Block by Block edition!</div><a aria-label="Skip link to February 14, 2022 - 28, 2022: Block by Block edition!" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#february-14-2022---28-2022-block-by-block-edition"></a></h2>
<blockquote class="callout callout_info" theme="üìò"><h2 class="callout-heading"><span class="callout-icon">üìò</span><p>The API is officially out of beta!</p></h2><p>Read more about it <a target="_self" href="https://www.notion.so/blog/api-ga">here</a>.</p></blockquote>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="features-7"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-features" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Features</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Features" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#features-7"></a></h3>
<ul>
<li>We now have a <a target="_self" href="/page/notion-platform-roadmap">roadmap</a>, so you have a better sense of what we&#x27;ll be building next.</li>
<li>We released a new version of the API, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">2022-02-22</code>. This version makes our requests and responses more consistent across properties, blocks, and filters, and officially deprecates the list databases endpoint. Read more <a target="_self" href="/changelog/releasing-notion-version-2022-02-22">here</a>.</li>
<li>We now show the public API status independently of Notion&#x27;s status on <a target="_self" href="https://status.notion.so/">https://status.notion.so/</a>.</li>
<li>Added <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">created_by</code> and <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">edited_by</code> to pages, blocks, and databases, and added <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">archived</code> to databases. Read more <a target="_self" href="/changelog/created-by-and-last-edited-by-properties-in-block-page-and-database-objects">here</a>.</li>
<li>Added new ways for admins of Enterprise workspaces to view and control the integrations installed in their workspaces. Read more <a target="_self" href="https://www.notion.so/help/add-and-manage-integrations-with-the-api">here</a>.</li>
<li>Added more information to paginated responses to make it easier to fetch complete responses for complex property types. Read more <a target="_self" href="/reference/pagination">here</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="bug-fixes-and-performance-improvements-7"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-bug-fixes-and-performance-improvements" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Bug fixes and performance improvements</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Bug fixes and performance improvements" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#bug-fixes-and-performance-improvements-7"></a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a bug where pages and databases with archived (i.e. trashed) ancestors would show <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">archived: false</code>. They now show <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">archived: true</code> because they are, in fact, archived.</li>
<li>Improved API performance when rendering users who are members in the space. This affects all user, block, and page-related endpoints since users can be mentioned in both page properties and rich text.</li>
<li>Added a message about sharing relevant pages and databases with a bot in the 404 not found error message. We found that this was one of the more common reasons for API users to get a 404 when calling the API.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug where bots could be given a more restrictive &quot;Can edit content&quot; access on child databases, which prevented some bots with write access from being able to update the database schema. </li>
<li>Fixed a bug where user mentions failed with &quot;user not found&quot; when creating new blocks, even if those users should have been visible to the bot.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug where malformed properties in a single page would cause an entire request to the query database endpoint to fail.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug where it was possible to update a page/database in the trash. Attempting to update a trashed page or database now returns a validation error.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug in the get page property endpoint where retrieving a rollup property which referenced a relation containing pages the bot did not have access to skipped those pages and returned an incorrect result. We now return a validation error.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug in the get page property endpoint where retrieving a formula property whose depth exceeds what we can compute in the API simply returned the wrong value. We now return a validation error.</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="march-1-2022"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-march-1-2022" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>March 1, 2022</div><a aria-label="Skip link to March 1, 2022" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#march-1-2022"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="created-by-and-last-edited-by-properties-in-block-page-and-database-objects"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-created-by-and-last-edited-by-properties-in-block-page-and-database-objects" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Created by and last edited by properties in Block, Page and Database objects</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Created by and last edited by properties in Block, Page and Database objects" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#created-by-and-last-edited-by-properties-in-block-page-and-database-objects"></a></h3>
<p>We have added <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">created_by</code> and <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">last_edited_by</code> properties for <a target="_self" href="/reference/block">block</a>, <a target="_self" href="/reference/page">page</a> and <a target="_self" href="/reference/database">database objects</a> corresponding to the users who have created or last edited these objects. Both properties are <a target="_self" href="/reference/user">user objects</a> which will contain¬†<button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">object</code>¬†and¬†<button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">id</code> keys. This is a backwards compatible change that is available in older versions of the API as well.</p>

<p>We have also added a boolean <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">archived</code> property for <a target="_self" href="/reference/database">database objects</a> to denote if the database has been deleted. You can use the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">archived</code> property to archive or unarchive a database and its descendants when <a target="_self" href="/reference/update-a-database">updating the database</a>.</p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="february-25-2022"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-february-25-2022" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>February 25, 2022</div><a aria-label="Skip link to February 25, 2022" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#february-25-2022"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="releasing-notion-version-2022-02-22"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-releasing-notion-version-2022-02-22" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Releasing Notion-Version 2022-02-22</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Releasing Notion-Version 2022-02-22" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#releasing-notion-version-2022-02-22"></a></h3>
<blockquote class="callout callout_info" theme="üìò"><h2 class="callout-heading"><span class="callout-icon">üìò</span><p>Notion&#x27;s API versions</p></h2><p>As a reminder, we only version backwards incompatible changes, so generally, you still get access to new features we release on the API without needing to upgrade. You can use different version headers for each request, so you can upgrade incrementally to get to the latest version.</p></blockquote>
<p>We&#x27;re releasing Notion-Version <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">2022-02-22</code> with the following <em>backwards incompatible</em> changes:</p>
<ul>
<li><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">text</code> in blocks has been renamed to <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">rich_text</code>, to be consistent with the database property type. </li>
<li>Query database filter changes:
<ul>
<li><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">phone</code> and <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">text</code> are no longer supported in query database filters when filtering by <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">phone_number</code> and <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">rich_text</code> properties. Use <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">phone_number</code> and <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">rich_text</code> instead.</li>
<li><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">rollup</code> query database filters no longer accept the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">text</code> keyword. Use <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">rich_text</code> instead.</li>
<li><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">formula</code> query database filters no longer accept the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">text</code> keyword. Use <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">string</code> instead.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">property_item</code> objects now return a <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">type</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">next_url</code>, and <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">id</code>.</li>
<li>Deprecated the List Databases API endpoint.</li>
</ul>
<h4 class="heading heading-4 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="the-text-property-in-content-blocks-has-been-renamed-to-rich_text"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-the-text-property-in-content-blocks-has-been-renamed-to-rich-text" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>The <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">text</code> property in content blocks has been renamed to <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">rich_text</code></div><a aria-label="Skip link to The " class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#the-text-property-in-content-blocks-has-been-renamed-to-rich_text"></a></h4>
<p>To be consistent with the database property type, we have renamed the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">text</code> property to <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">rich_text</code>. This affects the following block types: <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">paragraph</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">heading_1</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">heading_2</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">heading_3</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">callout</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">quote</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">bulleted_list_item</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">numbered_list_item</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">to_do</code> ,<button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">toggle</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">code</code> ,<button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">template</code>.</p>
<p>Here is an example of the previous <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">text</code> property:</p>
<div class="CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light"><div class="CodeTabs-toolbar" role="tablist"><button aria-selected="true" class="CodeTabs_active" role="tab" type="button">Previous paragraph block</button></div><div class="CodeTabs-inner" role="tabpanel"><pre><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang-json theme-light" data-lang="json" name="Previous paragraph block" tabindex="0">{
  &quot;type&quot;: &quot;paragraph&quot;,
  //...other keys excluded
  &quot;paragraph&quot;: {
    &quot;text&quot;: [{
      &quot;type&quot;: &quot;text&quot;,
      &quot;text&quot;: {
        &quot;content&quot;: &quot;Lacinato kale&quot;,
        &quot;link&quot;: null
      }
    }]
  }
}
</code></pre></div></div>
<p>Here is an example of the updated <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">rich_text</code> property:</p>
<div class="CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light"><div class="CodeTabs-toolbar" role="tablist"><button aria-selected="true" class="CodeTabs_active" role="tab" type="button">Updated paragraph block</button></div><div class="CodeTabs-inner" role="tabpanel"><pre><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang-json theme-light" data-lang="json" name="Updated paragraph block" tabindex="0">{
  &quot;type&quot;: &quot;paragraph&quot;,
  //...other keys excluded
  &quot;paragraph&quot;: {
    &quot;rich_text&quot;: [{
      &quot;type&quot;: &quot;text&quot;,
      &quot;text&quot;: {
        &quot;content&quot;: &quot;Lacinato kale&quot;,
        &quot;link&quot;: null
      }
    }]
  }
}
</code></pre></div></div>
<h4 class="heading heading-4 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="query-database-filter-changes"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-query-database-filter-changes" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Query database filter changes</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Query database filter changes" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#query-database-filter-changes"></a></h4>
<p><em><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">phone</code> and <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">text</code> no longer supported</em></p>
<p>Version 2022-02-22 no longer supports <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">phone</code> and <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">text</code> property filters in the query database endpoint. For consistency with the database property types, use <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">phone_number</code> and <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">rich_text</code> instead when filtering on <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">phone_number</code> and <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">rich_text</code> properties.</p>
<p>More concretely, this query database filter will throw a validation error:</p>
<div class="CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light"><div class="CodeTabs-toolbar" role="tablist"><button aria-selected="true" class="CodeTabs_active" role="tab" type="button">JSON</button></div><div class="CodeTabs-inner" role="tabpanel"><pre><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang-json theme-light" data-lang="json" name="" tabindex="0">{
	&quot;filter&quot;: {
		&quot;and&quot;: [
			{
				&quot;property&quot;: &quot;Phone number&quot;,
				&quot;phone&quot;: {
					&quot;equals&quot;: &quot;1112223333&quot;
				}
			}
		]
	}
}
</code></pre></div></div>
<p>This query database filter will succeed:</p>
<div class="CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light"><div class="CodeTabs-toolbar" role="tablist"><button aria-selected="true" class="CodeTabs_active" role="tab" type="button">JSON</button></div><div class="CodeTabs-inner" role="tabpanel"><pre><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang-json theme-light" data-lang="json" name="" tabindex="0">{
	&quot;filter&quot;: {
		&quot;and&quot;: [
			{
				&quot;property&quot;: &quot;Phone number&quot;,
				&quot;phone_number&quot;: {
					&quot;equals&quot;: &quot;1112223333&quot;
				}
			}
		]
	}
}
</code></pre></div></div>
<p><em><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">rollup</code> property filters accept <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">rich_text</code> instead of <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">text</code></em></p>
<p>Rollup property filters must now be constructed with the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">rich_text</code> keyword instead of the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">text</code> keyword if the value of the rollup is an array of <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">rich_text</code>. Put concretely, if a page&#x27;s rollup property is rendered like so:</p>
<div class="CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light"><div class="CodeTabs-toolbar" role="tablist"><button aria-selected="true" class="CodeTabs_active" role="tab" type="button">JSON</button></div><div class="CodeTabs-inner" role="tabpanel"><pre><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang-json theme-light" data-lang="json" name="" tabindex="0">&quot;rollup property&quot;: {
	&quot;id&quot;: &quot;~%5Bw%5C&quot;,
	&quot;type&quot;: &quot;rollup&quot;,
	&quot;rollup&quot;: {
		&quot;type&quot;: &quot;array&quot;,
		&quot;array&quot;: [
			{
				&quot;type&quot;: &quot;rich_text&quot;,
				&quot;rich_text&quot;: [
					{
						&quot;type&quot;: &quot;text&quot;,
						&quot;text&quot;: {
							&quot;content&quot;: &quot;update text 2&quot;,
							&quot;link&quot;: null
						},
						&quot;annotations&quot;: {
							&quot;bold&quot;: true,
							&quot;italic&quot;: false,
							&quot;strikethrough&quot;: false,
							&quot;underline&quot;: false,
							&quot;code&quot;: false,
							&quot;color&quot;: &quot;red&quot;
						},
						&quot;plain_text&quot;: &quot;update text 2&quot;,
						&quot;href&quot;: null
					}
				]
			},
			{
				&quot;type&quot;: &quot;rich_text&quot;,
				&quot;rich_text&quot;: [
					{
						&quot;type&quot;: &quot;text&quot;,
						&quot;text&quot;: {
