<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="august-11-2021"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-august-11-2021" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>August 11, 2021</div><a aria-label="Skip link to August 11, 2021" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#august-11-2021"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="oauth-token-response-now-includes-workspace-id-and-owner-info"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-o-auth-token-response-now-includes-workspace-id-and-owner-info" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>OAuth token response now includes workspace ID and owner info</div><a aria-label="Skip link to OAuth token response now includes workspace ID and owner info" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#oauth-token-response-now-includes-workspace-id-and-owner-info"></a></h3>
<p>We now return a <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">workspace_id</code> field and an <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">owner</code> in the <a target="_self" href="/docs/authorization#exchanging-the-grant-for-an-access-token">token response</a> at the very end of the OAuth authorization flow.</p>
<p><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">workspace_id</code> is the ID of the workspace where the integration was authorized. As a reminder, this is <strong>not</strong> intended to be unique across tokens; in future iterations of our authorization flow users may be able to authorize your integration multiple times in the same workspace.</p>
<p><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">owner</code> contains information about who can view and share the integration. Because all integrations today can be viewed and shared by all members in the space, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">owner</code> is just an object that looks like <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">{ &quot;workspace&quot;: true }</code> for now. </p>
<p>To summarize, the OAuth token response now looks like this:</p>















































<div class="rdmd-table"><div class="rdmd-table-inner"><table><thead><tr><th>Field</th><th>Type</th><th>Description</th><th style="text-align:center">Not null</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">&quot;access_token&quot;</code></td><td><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">string</code></td><td>An access token used to authorize requests to the Notion API.</td><td style="text-align:center">‚úÖ</td></tr><tr><td><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">&quot;workspace_id&quot;</code></td><td><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">string</code></td><td>The ID of the workspace where this authorization took place.</td><td style="text-align:center">‚úÖ</td></tr><tr><td><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">&quot;workspace_name&quot;</code></td><td><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">string</code></td><td>A human-readable name which can be used to display this authorization in UI.</td><td style="text-align:center"></td></tr><tr><td><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">&quot;workspace_icon&quot;</code></td><td><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">string</code></td><td>A URL to an image which can be used to display this authorization in UI.</td><td style="text-align:center"></td></tr><tr><td><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">&quot;bot_id&quot;</code></td><td><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">string</code></td><td>An identifier for this authorization.</td><td style="text-align:center">‚úÖ</td></tr><tr><td><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">&quot;owner&quot;</code></td><td><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">object</code></td><td>An object containing information about who can view and share this integration. Always <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">{ &quot;workspace&quot;: true }</code> for now.</td><td style="text-align:center">‚úÖ</td></tr></tbody></table></div></div>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="august-11-2021-1"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-august-11-2021" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>August 11, 2021</div><a aria-label="Skip link to August 11, 2021" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#august-11-2021-1"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="update-existing-databases-with-patch-v1databases"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-update-existing-databases-with-patch-v-1-databases" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Update existing databases with PATCH /v1/databases</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Update existing databases with PATCH /v1/databases" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#update-existing-databases-with-patch-v1databases"></a></h3>
<p>You can now use the Notion API to <a target="_self" href="/reference/update-a-database">update databases</a>! </p>
<p>Supported updates are:</p>
<ul>
<li>renaming the database</li>
<li>adding and removing properties</li>
<li>renaming properties</li>
<li>updating property types. </li>
</ul>
<p>Note that updating the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">name</code> and <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">color</code> select and multi select options is not supported.</p>
<h4 class="heading heading-4 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="example-request-3"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-example-request" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Example request</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Example request" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#example-request-3"></a></h4>

--header &#x27;Authorization: Bearer &#x27;&quot;$NOTION_API_KEY&quot;&#x27;&#x27; \
--header &#x27;Content-Type: application/json&#x27; \
--header &#x27;Notion-Version: 2021-07-27&#x27; \
--data &#x27;{
    &quot;title&quot;: [
        {
            &quot;text&quot;: {
                &quot;content&quot;: &quot;Today&#x27;\&#x27;&#x27;s grocery list&quot;
            }
        }
    ],
    &quot;properties&quot;: {
        &quot;+1&quot;: null,
        &quot;Photo&quot;: {
            &quot;url&quot;: {}
        },
        &quot;Store availability&quot;: {
            &quot;multi_select&quot;: {
                &quot;options&quot;: [
                    {
                        &quot;name&quot;: &quot;Duc Loi Market&quot;
                    },
                    {
                        &quot;name&quot;: &quot;Rainbow Grocery&quot;
                    },
                    {
                        &quot;name&quot;: &quot;Gus&#x27;\&#x27;&#x27;s Community Market&quot;
                    },
                    {
                        &quot;name&quot;: &quot;The Good Life Grocery&quot;,
                        &quot;color&quot;: &quot;orange&quot;
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    }       
}&#x27;
</code></pre></div></div>

<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="august-3-2021"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-august-3-2021" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>August 3, 2021</div><a aria-label="Skip link to August 3, 2021" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#august-3-2021"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="retrieve-and-update-blocks-with-get-and-patch-v1blocksid"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-retrieve-and-update-blocks-with-get-and-patch-v-1-blocks-id" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Retrieve and update blocks with GET and PATCH /v1/blocks/:id</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Retrieve and update blocks with GET and PATCH /v1/blocks/:id" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#retrieve-and-update-blocks-with-get-and-patch-v1blocksid"></a></h3>
<p>You can now retrieve and update block objects with the Notion API! The <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">PATCH</code> endpoint currently supports updating <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">paragraph</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">heading_1</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">heading_2</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">heading_3</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">bulleted_list_item</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">numbered_list_item</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">toggle</code> and <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">to_do</code> blocks.</p>
<h4 class="heading heading-4 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="retrieve-a-block"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-retrieve-a-block" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Retrieve a Block</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Retrieve a Block" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#retrieve-a-block"></a></h4>
<p>The <a target="_self" href="/reference/retrieve-a-block">Retrieve a Block</a> endpoint returns a <a target="_self" href="/reference/block">Block Object</a>. </p>
<div class="CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light"><div class="CodeTabs-toolbar" role="tablist"><button aria-selected="true" class="CodeTabs_active" role="tab" type="button">Example GET request</button></div><div class="CodeTabs-inner" role="tabpanel"><pre><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang-curl theme-light" data-lang="curl" name="Example GET request" tabindex="0">curl &#x27;https://api.notion.com/v1/blocks/9bc30ad4-9373-46a5-84ab-0a7845ee52e6&#x27; \
  -H &#x27;Authorization: Bearer &#x27;&quot;$NOTION_API_KEY&quot;&#x27;&#x27; \
  -H &#x27;Notion-Version: 2021-05-13&#x27;
</code></pre></div></div>
<div class="CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light"><div class="CodeTabs-toolbar" role="tablist"><button aria-selected="true" class="CodeTabs_active" role="tab" type="button">Example response</button></div><div class="CodeTabs-inner" role="tabpanel"><pre><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang-json theme-light" data-lang="json" name="Example response" tabindex="0">{
  &quot;object&quot;: &quot;block&quot;,
  &quot;id&quot;: &quot;9bc30ad4-9373-46a5-84ab-0a7845ee52e6&quot;,
  &quot;created_time&quot;: &quot;2021-03-16T16:31:00.000Z&quot;,
  &quot;last_edited_time&quot;: &quot;2021-03-16T16:32:00.000Z&quot;,
  &quot;has_children&quot;: false,
  &quot;type&quot;: &quot;to_do&quot;,
  &quot;to_do&quot;: {
    &quot;text&quot;: [
      {
        &quot;type&quot;: &quot;text&quot;,
        &quot;text&quot;: {
          &quot;content&quot;: &quot;Lacinato kale&quot;,
          &quot;link&quot;: null
        },
        &quot;annotations&quot;: {
          &quot;bold&quot;: false,
          &quot;italic&quot;: false,
          &quot;strikethrough&quot;: false,
          &quot;underline&quot;: false,
          &quot;code&quot;: false,
          &quot;color&quot;: &quot;default&quot;
        },
        &quot;plain_text&quot;: &quot;Lacinato kale&quot;,
        &quot;href&quot;: null
      }
    ],
    &quot;checked&quot;: false
  }
}
</code></pre></div></div>
<h4 class="heading heading-4 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="update-a-block"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-update-a-block" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Update a Block</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Update a Block" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#update-a-block"></a></h4>
<p>The new <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">PATCH</code> <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">/v1/blocks/:id</code> endpoint supports updating block content (the properties within the block type object) and returns the updated <a target="_self" href="/reference/block">Block Object</a>, same as the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">GET</code> endpoint shown above. See the <a target="_self" href="/reference/update-a-block">Update a Block</a> documentation for more detail.</p>
<div class="CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light"><div class="CodeTabs-toolbar" role="tablist"><button aria-selected="true" class="CodeTabs_active" role="tab" type="button">Example PATCH request</button></div><div class="CodeTabs-inner" role="tabpanel"><pre><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang-curl theme-light" data-lang="curl" name="Example PATCH request" tabindex="0">curl https://api.notion.com/v1/blocks/9bc30ad4-9373-46a5-84ab-0a7845ee52e6 \
  -H &#x27;Authorization: Bearer &#x27;&quot;$NOTION_API_KEY&quot;&#x27;&#x27; \
  -H &quot;Content-Type: application/json&quot; \
  -H &quot;Notion-Version: 2021-05-13&quot; \
  -X PATCH \
  --data &#x27;{
  &quot;to_do&quot;: {
    &quot;text&quot;: [{ 
      &quot;text&quot;: { &quot;content&quot;: &quot;Lacinato kale&quot; } 
      }],
    &quot;checked&quot;: false
  }
}&#x27;
</code></pre></div></div>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="july-26-2021"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-july-26-2021" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>July 26, 2021</div><a aria-label="Skip link to July 26, 2021" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#july-26-2021"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="number-properties-now-support-more-currency-formats"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-number-properties-now-support-more-currency-formats" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Number properties now support more currency formats</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Number properties now support more currency formats" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#number-properties-now-support-more-currency-formats"></a></h3>
<p>The number property type in databases now supports additional currency options.</p>
<p>The new options are:</p>
<ul>
<li>&quot;hong_kong_dollar&quot;</li>
<li>&quot;new_zealand_dollar&quot;</li>
<li>&quot;krona&quot;</li>
<li>&quot;norwegian_krone&quot;</li>
<li>&quot;mexican_peso&quot;</li>
<li>&quot;rand&quot;</li>
<li>&quot;new_taiwan_dollar&quot;</li>
<li>&quot;danish_krone&quot;</li>
<li>&quot;zloty&quot;</li>
<li>&quot;baht&quot;</li>
<li>&quot;forint&quot;</li>
<li>&quot;koruna&quot;</li>
<li>&quot;shekel&quot;</li>
<li>&quot;chilean_peso&quot;</li>
<li>&quot;philippine_peso&quot;</li>
<li>&quot;dirham&quot;</li>
<li>&quot;colombian_peso&quot;</li>
<li>&quot;riyal&quot;</li>
<li>&quot;ringgit&quot;</li>
<li>&quot;leu&quot;</li>
</ul>
<p>This impacts the <a target="_self" href="/reference/database#number-configuration">number configuration of databases</a>.</p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="july-22-2021"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-july-22-2021" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>July 22, 2021</div><a aria-label="Skip link to July 22, 2021" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#july-22-2021"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="oauth-improvements"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-o-auth-improvements" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>OAuth improvements</div><a aria-label="Skip link to OAuth improvements" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#oauth-improvements"></a></h3>
<p>We&#x27;ve made improvements to the OAuth flow to make it easier to use.</p>
<p><strong>We now show the page picker on reauthorization.</strong> Just like before, the user who initially authorized an integration can reauthorize by going through OAuth a second time. The page picker step will remember which pages have already been shared with the integration, if any, and let users share or un-share additional pages.</p>
<p><strong>Users can search for pages to share with an integration.</strong> Previously, users could only select pages at the top level of the Workspace, Shared section, or Private pages section to share with an integration, but we&#x27;ve added a search bar so users can search for and select any page in their workspace. </p>
<p>We also updated the page picker to only show pages for which the user has Full Access permission. Previously, the page picker show any pages for which the user had at least Can View permission, but would show an error when they tried to give the permission access to those pages.</p>
<p>Other OAuth behavior has not changed: only admins can go through OAuth, and only the original person originally added an integration via OAuth can go through the flow again.</p>
<figure><span aria-label="1164" class="img lightbox closed" role="button" tabindex="0"><span class="lightbox-inner"><img alt="1164" loading="lazy" src="https://files.readme.io/15c452e-oauth_improvements.png" title="oauth_improvements.png" align="center" class="" caption="" height="auto" width="auto"/></span></span><figcaption><p>The search bar now lets you search for and select nested pages to share with an integration.</p></figcaption></figure>
<figure><span aria-label="1134" class="img lightbox closed" role="button" tabindex="0"><span class="lightbox-inner"><img alt="1134" loading="lazy" src="https://files.readme.io/63ac8e6-oauth2.png" title="oauth2.png" align="center" class="" caption="" height="auto" width="auto"/></span></span><figcaption><p>Once selected, any nested pages appear in the &quot;Manually Added&quot; section.</p></figcaption></figure>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="july-21-2021"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-july-21-2021" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>July 21, 2021</div><a aria-label="Skip link to July 21, 2021" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#july-21-2021"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="database-property-objects-now-include-the-property-name"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-database-property-objects-now-include-the-property-name" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Database property objects now include the property name</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Database property objects now include the property name" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#database-property-objects-now-include-the-property-name"></a></h3>
<p><a target="_self" href="/reference/database#database-property">Database property objects</a> now include the field <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">name</code> with the property name as it appears in Notion.</p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="july-15-2021"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-july-15-2021" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>July 15, 2021</div><a aria-label="Skip link to July 15, 2021" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#july-15-2021"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="rollup-property-functions-now-include-show_original"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-rollup-property-functions-now-include-show-original" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Rollup property functions now include show_original</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Rollup property functions now include show_original" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#rollup-property-functions-now-include-show_original"></a></h3>
<p>The <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">function</code> <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">show_original</code> has now been added to <a target="_self" href="/reference/database#rollup-configuration">rollup database property objects</a>. This fixes a bug where rollup properties were omitted if the calculation was &quot;Show Original&quot;.</p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="july-13-2021"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-july-13-2021" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>July 13, 2021</div><a aria-label="Skip link to July 13, 2021" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#july-13-2021"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="create-new-databases-with-post-v1databases"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-create-new-databases-with-post-v-1-databases" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Create new databases with POST /v1/databases</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Create new databases with POST /v1/databases" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#create-new-databases-with-post-v1databases"></a></h3>
<p>You can now use the Notion API to <a target="_self" href="/reference/create-a-database">create a database</a> as a subpage of an existing page. Currently supported property types are <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">&quot;title&quot;</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">&quot;rich_text&quot;</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">&quot;number&quot;</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">&quot;select&quot;</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">&quot;people&quot;</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">&quot;checkbox&quot;</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">&quot;url&quot;</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">&quot;email&quot;</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" <h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="july-7-2021"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-july-7-2021" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>July 7, 2021</div><a aria-label="Skip link to July 7, 2021" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#july-7-2021"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="user-mentions-can-only-be-of-people"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-user-mentions-can-only-be-of-people" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>User mentions can only be of people</div><a aria-label="Skip link to User mentions can only be of people" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#user-mentions-can-only-be-of-people"></a></h3>
<p>To be consistent with the Notion application, only users of type &quot;people&quot; can be mentioned in rich text objects or in people properties of databases. Trying to include users of type &quot;bot&quot; will return a validation error. Existing mentions of bot users is unaffected.</p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="july-1-2021"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-july-1-2021" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>July 1, 2021</div><a aria-label="Skip link to July 1, 2021" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#july-1-2021"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="page-objects-now-contain-url"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-page-objects-now-contain-url" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Page objects now contain url</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Page objects now contain url" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#page-objects-now-contain-url"></a></h3>
<p><a target="_self" href="/reference/page#all-pages">Page objects</a> now return the web address of the page in the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">url</code> key. </p>
<div class="CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light"><div class="CodeTabs-toolbar" role="tablist"><button aria-selected="true" class="CodeTabs_active" role="tab" type="button">JSON</button></div><div class="CodeTabs-inner" role="tabpanel"><pre><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang-json theme-light" data-lang="json" name="" tabindex="0">{
  &quot;object&quot;: &quot;page&quot;,
  &quot;id&quot;: &quot;251d2b5f-268c-4de2-afe9-c71ff92ca95c&quot;,
	&quot;created_time&quot;: &quot;2020-03-17T19:10:04.968Z&quot;,
	&quot;last_edited_time&quot;: &quot;2020-03-17T21:49:37.913Z&quot;,
  &quot;parent&quot;: {
    &quot;type&quot;: &quot;database_id&quot;,
    &quot;database_id&quot;: &quot;48f8fee9-cd79-4180-bc2f-ec0398253067&quot;
  },
  &quot;archived&quot;: false,
  &quot;url&quot;: &quot;https://www.notion.so/Avocado-251d2b5f268c4de2afe9c71ff92ca95c&quot;,
  &quot;properties&quot;: {
    &quot;Name&quot;: {
      &quot;id&quot;: &quot;title&quot;,
      &quot;type&quot;: &quot;title&quot;,
      &quot;title&quot;: [
        {
          &quot;type&quot;: &quot;text&quot;,
          &quot;text&quot;: {
            &quot;content&quot;: &quot;Avocado&quot;,
            &quot;link&quot;: null
          },
          &quot;annotations&quot;: {
            &quot;bold&quot;: false,
            &quot;italic&quot;: false,
            &quot;strikethrough&quot;: false,
            &quot;underline&quot;: false,
            &quot;code&quot;: false,
            &quot;color&quot;: &quot;default&quot;
          },
          &quot;plain_text&quot;: &quot;Avocado&quot;,
          &quot;href&quot;: null
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}
</code></pre></div></div>
<p>This impacts endpoints that return page object: the <a target="_self" href="/reference/page">pages</a> endpoints and <a target="_self" href="/reference/post-database-query">query database</a> endpoint.</p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="june-28-2021"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-june-28-2021" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>June 28, 2021</div><a aria-label="Skip link to June 28, 2021" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#june-28-2021"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="last-edited-and-created-time-properties-are-now-rounded-to-the-nearest-minute"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-last-edited-and-created-time-properties-are-now-rounded-to-the-nearest-minute" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Last edited and created time properties are now rounded to the nearest minute</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Last edited and created time properties are now rounded to the nearest minute" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#last-edited-and-created-time-properties-are-now-rounded-to-the-nearest-minute"></a></h3>
<p>Starting July 1st, the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">last_edited_time</code> and <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">created_time</code> properties will be rounded down to the closest minute for <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">page</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">database</code> , and <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">block</code> objects. Previously, this behavior was inconsistent with some times being rounded and others not.</p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="june-23-2021"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-june-23-2021" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>June 23, 2021</div><a aria-label="Skip link to June 23, 2021" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#june-23-2021"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="database-objects-now-return-parent"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-database-objects-now-return-parent" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Database objects now return parent</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Database objects now return parent" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#database-objects-now-return-parent"></a></h3>
<p>Database objects now return a <a target="_self" href="/reference/database#page-parent">parent property</a>. Databases can have pages or workspaces as parents.</p>
<div class="CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light"><div class="CodeTabs-toolbar" role="tablist"><button aria-selected="true" class="CodeTabs_active" role="tab" type="button">JSON</button></div><div class="CodeTabs-inner" role="tabpanel"><pre><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang-json theme-light" data-lang="json" name="" tabindex="0">{
  &quot;parent&quot;: {
    &quot;type&quot;: &quot;page_id&quot;,
    &quot;page_id&quot;: &quot;b8595b75-abd1-4cad-8dfe-f935a8ef57cb&quot;
}
</code></pre></div></div>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="other-improvements-and-fixes"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-other-improvements-and-fixes" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Other Improvements and Fixes</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Other Improvements and Fixes" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#other-improvements-and-fixes"></a></h3>
<ul>
<li>Inline database mentions are now included in <a target="_self" href="/reference/rich-text#database-mentions">rich_text mention</a> responses.</li>
<li>When an integration does not have access to a <a target="_self" href="/reference/rich-text#page-mentions">page or database mention</a>, we will no longer completely omit the mention. The mention will be returned with just the ID but without detailed information (title will appear as &quot;Untitled&quot; and annotations will be default).</li>
<li>When integrations are added to pages inside collections they can now always update page properties, even when the integration does not have access to the parent database. However, integrations will not be able to add new <a target="_self" href="/reference/page#select-property-values">select</a> or <a target="_self" href="/reference/page#multi-select-property-values">multi-select</a> properties through the create or update page endpoints without the ability to edit the database parent.</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="june-15-2021"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-june-15-2021" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>June 15, 2021</div><a aria-label="Skip link to June 15, 2021" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#june-15-2021"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="select-values-can-now-be-dynamically-created-via-create-and-update-page-endpoints--other-updates-since-public-beta-launch"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-select-values-can-now-be-dynamically-created-via-create-and-update-page-endpoints-other-updates-since-public-beta-launch" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Select values can now be dynamically created via Create and Update Page endpoints + other updates since public beta launch</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Select values can now be dynamically created via Create and Update Page endpoints + other updates since public beta launch" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#select-values-can-now-be-dynamically-created-via-create-and-update-page-endpoints--other-updates-since-public-beta-launch"></a></h3>
<p>You can now dynamically create new options for <a target="_self" href="/reference/database#select-configuration">Select</a> or  <a target="_self" href="/reference/database#multi-select-configuration">Multi-Select properties</a> when using the <a target="_self" href="/reference/post-page">Create Page</a> and <a target="_self" href="/reference/patch-page">Update Page</a> endpoints. When specifying an option that does not exist in the database schema already, the option will now be created and the database schema updated accordingly. </p>
<div class="CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light"><div class="CodeTabs-toolbar" role="tablist"><button aria-selected="true" class="CodeTabs_active" role="tab" type="button">JSON</button></div><div class="CodeTabs-inner" role="tabpanel"><pre><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang-json theme-light" data-lang="json" name="" tabindex="0">{
  &quot;properties&quot;: {
    &quot;Food group&quot;: {
      &quot;multi_select&quot;: [{&quot;name&quot;: &quot;Vegetable&quot;},{&quot;name&quot;: &quot;Fruit&quot;}]
    }
  }
}
</code></pre></div></div>
<p>In the above <a target="_self" href="/reference/page-property-value">property values</a> example: Previously, if either &quot;Vegetable&quot; or &quot;Fruit&quot; did not already exist as an option in the database schema, an error would be returned that these are not valid Select options. Now, these options will be created dynamically.</p>
<p><strong>Bug Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>The title property of a page can be set, and a page can be archived or un-archived, even when the page does not belong to a database.</li>
<li><a target="_self" href="/reference/get-page">Retrieving pages</a> that are shared with an integration, but where the page&#x27;s parent is not shared, no longer erroneously returns a 404.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Other Changes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li><a target="_self" href="/reference/post-search">Search endpoint</a> now returns untitled pages.</li>
<li>Applies to <a target="_self" href="versioning#changes-by-version">version 2021-05-13</a> and later only: The <a target="_self" href="/reference/post-database-query">Query Database</a> endpoint no longer accepts query parameters ‚Äì these should be sent as body parameters.</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="may-19-2021"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-may-19-2021" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>May 19, 2021</div><a aria-label="Skip link to May 19, 2021" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#may-19-2021"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="notion-version-header-will-be-required-starting-june-1-2021"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-notion-version-header-will-be-required-starting-june-1-2021" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>&quot;Notion-Version&quot; header will be required starting June 1, 2021</div><a aria-label="Skip link to &quot;Notion-Version&quot; header will be required starting June 1, 2021" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#notion-version-header-will-be-required-starting-june-1-2021"></a></h3>
<p>The Notion API has recommended using an explicit version to every HTTP request, using the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">Notion-Version</code> header. <strong>For integrations created after June 1, 2021 an explicit version on every request will become required</strong>. After July 1, 2021, integrations created before June 1, 2021 will also have the same requirement. Today, the most recent version is <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">&quot;2021-05-13&quot;</code>.</p>
<h4 class="heading heading-4 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="is-my-integration-affected-what-should-i-do-to-update"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-is-my-integration-affected-what-should-i-do-to-update" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Is my integration affected? What should I do to update?</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Is my integration affected? What should I do to update?" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#is-my-integration-affected-what-should-i-do-to-update"></a></h4>
<p>This requirement will not break your existing integration; however, we will start enforcing this requirement for all API requests on July 1st. Starting July 1st, if you don&#x27;t send the Notion-Version header with your Notion API calls, you will get a <a target="_self" href="/reference/errors"><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">&quot;missing_version&quot;</code> error</a>. Learn more about how the Notion API <a target="_self" href="/reference/versioning">handles versioning</a>.</p>
<p>If you&#x27;ve been using examples copied from documentation or example code since the public beta, including using the <a target="_self" href="https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js">Notion SDK for JavaScript</a>, your existing code should continue to work as expected.</p>
<p>Otherwise, please make one of the two following changes before July 1:</p>
<ol>
<li>Add <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">Notion-Version: 2021-05-11</code> in the header when making requests (no other code change is needed).</li>
<li><strong>Recommended</strong>: Add <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">Notion-Version: 2021-05-13</code> in the header when making requests.  Making this change will move you to our newest version which includes the following breaking change.</li>
</ol>
<h4 class="heading heading-4 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="breaking-changes-in-version-2021-05-13"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-breaking-changes-in-version-2021-05-13" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Breaking changes in version <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">2021-05-13</code></div><a aria-label="Skip link to Breaking changes in version " class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#breaking-changes-in-version-2021-05-13"></a></h4>
<p>The <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">type</code> of <a target="_self" href="/reference/page-property-value">property value objects</a> for rich text properties has changed from <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">&quot;text&quot;</code> to <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">&quot;rich_text&quot;</code>.</p>
<p>When <a target="_self" href="/reference/post-page">creating pages</a> and <a target="_self" href="/reference/patch-page">updating page properties</a>, update page property values that are rich text to use the key <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">rich_text</code> instead of <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">text</code>. Similarly when <a target="_self" href="/reference/get-page">retrieving a page</a>, rich text properties will be returned with the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">type</code>  <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">&quot;rich_text&quot;</code> instead of <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">&quot;text&quot;</code>.</p>
<p>This change helps distinguish between the property type, and the inner text values of <a target="_self" href="/reference/rich-text">rich text object</a>, which have the key <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">text</code>.</p>
<p>To illustrate this change, here is an example of how the <a target="_self" href="/reference/page">page object</a>&#x27;s <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">properties</code> appear before and after:</p>
<div class="CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light"><div class="CodeTabs-toolbar" role="tablist"><button aria-selected="true" class="CodeTabs_active" role="tab" type="button">JavaScript</button></div><div class="CodeTabs-inner" role="tabpanel"><pre><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang-js theme-light" data-lang="js" name="" tabindex="0">// Before (in unversioned requests and responses)
{
  &quot;object&quot;: &quot;page&quot;,
  &quot;properties&quot;: {
    &quot;Description&quot;: {
      &quot;type&quot;: &quot;text&quot;,
      &quot;text&quot;: [
        {
          &quot;type&quot;: &quot;text&quot;,
          &quot;text&quot;: { &quot;content&quot;: &quot;Hello World&quot; }
        }
      ]
    }
  }
  /* remaining details omitted */
}
</code></pre></div></div>
<div class="CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light"><div class="CodeTabs-toolbar" role="tablist"><button aria-selected="true" class="CodeTabs_active" role="tab" type="button">JavaScript</button></div><div class="CodeTabs-inner" role="tabpanel"><pre><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang-js theme-light" data-lang="js" name="" tabindex="0">// After (in requests and responses with version 2021-05-13)
{
  &quot;object&quot;: &quot;page&quot;,
  &quot;properties&quot;: {
    &quot;Description&quot;: {
      &quot;type&quot;: &quot;rich_text&quot;,
      &quot;rich_text&quot;: [
        {
          &quot;type&quot;: &quot;text&quot;,
          &quot;text&quot;: { &quot;content&quot;: &quot;Hello World&quot; }
        }
      ]
    }
  }
  /* remaining details omitted */
}
</code></pre></div></div>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="may-18-2021"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-may-18-2021" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>May 18, 2021</div><a aria-label="Skip link to May 18, 2021" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#may-18-2021"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="initial-users-may-reauthorize-a-public-integration-using-oauth"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-initial-users-may-reauthorize-a-public-integration-using-o-auth" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Initial users may reauthorize a public integration using OAuth</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Initial users may reauthorize a public integration using OAuth" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#initial-users-may-reauthorize-a-public-integration-using-oauth"></a></h3>
<p>Public integrations use OAuth to <a target="_self" href="/docs/authorization#prompting-users-to-add-an-integration">request authorization from a user</a> before being added to a Notion workspace. Previously, once an integration was added to a workspace, no users were able to reauthorize the same integration in that workspace. This change allows the user who initially added the integration to complete the authorization flow more than once. This improvement helps integrations avoid a potential dead end in user flows.</p>
<p>Integrations do not need to make any updates to take advantage of this new capability. An integration may simply link or redirect a user to the authorization URL, the same as the first authorization. During reauthorization the user will not see the page picker. The access token received at the end of reauthorization will be the same as the initial access token. This capability is available immediately.</p>
<p>Please be aware that other previous limitations still exist. Only users with admin access level in a workspace can add an integration. Integrations can only be added to a workspace by one user.</p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="may-13-2021"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-may-13-2021" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>May 13, 2021</div><a aria-label="Skip link to May 13, 2021" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#may-13-2021"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="hello-world-the-notion-api-is-now-in-public-beta"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-hello-world-the-notion-api-is-now-in-public-beta" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Hello world, the Notion API is now in public beta</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Hello world, the Notion API is now in public beta" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#hello-world-the-notion-api-is-now-in-public-beta"></a></h3>
<p>The Notion API is now available for all developers to explore and build upon. Integrations built on the API are available to all Notion users, on free or paid plans.</p>
<p>In this public beta release, you&#x27;ll find many of the fundamental parts of Notion: reading and writing to pages, working with users, and the deep and powerful world of Notion databases. The API itself offers foundational features such as authorization, pagination, limits, and more. This is enough to build many interesting integrations we&#x27;ve heard Notion users are excited to use. We&#x27;re excited to see what you&#x27;ll build for all of us. <a target="_self" href="/docs/getting-started">‚Üí Get started</a></p>
<p>Our goal is to establish that the Notion API is robust, easy to use, and trustworthy. In public beta, we‚Äôll continue to add new features and making significant changes based on your feedback. Once the most important improvements are included, the API will transition from public beta to general availability. you‚Äôll have everything you need to build integrations teams and businesses can depend on.</p>
<p>A special thanks to the all developers who experimented, explored, and shared their ideas with us - both in the private beta and those following along.</p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="may-4-2021"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-may-4-2021" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>May 4, 2021</div><a aria-label="Skip link to May 4, 2021" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#may-4-2021"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="public-integration-type-extends-access-to-multiple-workspaces-using-oauth"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-public-integration-type-extends-access-to-multiple-workspaces-using-o-auth" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Public integration type extends access to multiple workspaces using OAuth</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Public integration type extends access to multiple workspaces using OAuth" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#public-integration-type-extends-access-to-multiple-workspaces-using-oauth"></a></h3>
<p>The Notion API has added a new integration type: Public OAuth integrations. If you&#x27;re building a product or service for Notion users outside your own team - public integrations are for developers like you. </p>
<p>In order to create and configure an integration, its type, name, avatar, and other related settings, the <a target="_self" href="https://www.notion.com/my-integrations">My integrations</a> page is now available.</p>
<p>Public integrations use OAuth to request permission to access pages and databases in new workspaces. Once the user accepts, the integration can receive a separate access token for resources in the user&#x27;s workspace.</p>
<p>Existing integrations are now known as internal integrations. We no longer call the bearer token you previously used an API Key. It&#x27;s now known as an integration token. You can keep your bearer token around - it will continue to work just the same.</p>
<p>Learn how to implement these changes in the <a target="_self" href="/docs/authorization">authorization guide</a>.</p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="may-3-2021"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-may-3-2021" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>May 3, 2021</div><a aria-label="Skip link to May 3, 2021" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#may-3-2021"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="search-is-now-available-in-the-api"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-search-is-now-available-in-the-api" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Search is now available in the API</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Search is now available in the API" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#search-is-now-available-in-the-api"></a></h3>
<p>Using the new <a target="_self" href="/reference/post-search">search endpoint</a>, you can query all pages and databases users have shared with your integration.</p>
<p>The query you provide filters results by matching against the page title. The results also include matches against subpages of pages users have shared with your integration. This endpoint can be helpful when onboarding a new user and trying to find the page they just shared with your integration.</p>
<p>We recommend transitioning away from using the <a target="_self" href="/reference/get-databases">list databases endpoint</a>. The search endpoint provides all the same functionality - and more.</p></div><div class="UpdatedAt"><p class="DateLine "><i class="icon icon-watch"></i>Updated<!-- --> <!-- -->3 months ago<!-- --> This is kept separate from the current changelog to keep page navigation faster while retaining older updates.\n\n## August 23 - September 5, 2023\n\n- The [Working with databases guide](https://developers.notion.com/docs/working-with-databases) was revised to improve its readability and to make additional resources easier to find.\n- Notion's [Postman collection](https://www.postman.com/notionhq/workspace/notion-s-api-workspace/collection/15568543-d990f9b7-98d3-47d3-9131-4866ab9c6df2) for the API was updated. Be sure to pull recent changes into your forked version.\n- A reminder was added to the [Comments endpoints](https://developers.notion.com/reference/create-a-comment) to update [integration capabilities](https://developers.notion.com/reference/capabilities) for comments prior to using the endpoints. (Read/write comment capabilities are off by default and can be turned on in the [integration dashboard](https://www.notion.so/my-integrations).)\n- General clean-up and improvements, including code formatting.\n\n## August 8 - August 22, 2023\n\n- The [Build your first integration](https://developers.notion.com/docs/create-a-notion-integration) guide was rewritten with new demo code to help developers learn how to use Notion‚Äôs API even faster.\n  - A new [sample app](https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js/tree/main/examples/web-form-with-express) was added to the [Notion SDK for JavaScript](https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js/tree/main) `/examples` directory. This completed sample app is referenced in the new [Build your first integration](https://developers.notion.com/docs/create-a-notion-integration) guide.\n- The description for the `block_id` path parameter was updated for the [Append block children](https://developers.notion.com/reference/patch-block-children) endpoint to indicate that a block ID or page ID can be used.\n- A clarification was added to [documentation](https://developers.notion.com/reference/retrieve-a-database) for retrieving/updating database properties: If a property is based on a relation to another database, the related database also needs to be shared with the integration.\n- A clarification was added to documentation for [querying databases](https://developers.notion.com/reference/post-database-query-filter#multi-select). When filtering a multi-select property, the `contains` field will filter for exact matches for the string provided.\n- The [Working with comments](https://developers.notion.com/docs/working-with-comments) guide was updated with additional examples to distinguish between creating page comments and inline discussion comments.\n  - The [Create a comment](https://developers.notion.com/reference/create-a-comment) endpoint description now links to the Working with comments guide to help developers find additional resources faster.\n- If you haven‚Äôt already, join our [Notion Devs Slack group](https://join.slack.com/t/notiondevs/shared_invite/zt-20b5996xv-DzJdLiympy6jP0GGzu3AMg) to learn from other developers building with the public API.\n\n### Notice for an upcoming Public API change\n\n#### We will soon be rolling out changes to the Formulas property (Formulas 2.0), and as such, we will be making a change to the Notion Public API.\n\nThis is a non-versioned change and is expected to be in effect in the next couple weeks.\n\n**tl;dr:** As part of the Formulas 2.0 rollout, the Public API‚Äôs format of the string value for [`formula.expression`](https://developers.notion.com/reference/property-object#formula) will be changing. Public API calls with formula inputs in the old format will still succeed. On write operations, the old format will be supported indefinitely, but on read, only the new format will be returned. This change is being made to improve the formulas experience and ensure parity with the Notion app. \n\nNo action is required for creating or updating database formulas. Reading database [`formula.expression`](https://developers.notion.com/reference/property-object#formula) values may require developer changes.\n\n#### What do you need to know?\n\n **The string value of `formula.expression` is changing; the schema is not.** \n\n- **On write** via the Public API ([create](https://developers.notion.com/reference/create-a-database) or [update](https://developers.notion.com/reference/update-a-database) database endpoints), Notion will support using the old format as a Public API input in the formula property schema indefinitely _and_ will support writing in the **new** format.\n- Database objects returned via the Public API will have the new formulas 2.0 format.\n\n```javascript\n// Old format\n\&quot;Updated price\&quot;: {\n  \&quot;id\&quot;: \&quot;YU%7C%40\&quot;,\n  \&quot;name\&quot;: \&quot;Updated price\&quot;,\n  \&quot;type\&quot;: \&quot;formula\&quot;,\n  \&quot;formula\&quot;: {\n    \&quot;expression\&quot;: \&quot;prop(\\\&quot;Price\\\&quot;) * 2\&quot;\n  }\n}\n\n// New format (upcoming)\n\&quot;Updated price\&quot;: {\n  \&quot;id\&quot;: \&quot;YU%7C%40\&quot;,\n  \&quot;name\&quot;: \&quot;Updated price\&quot;,\n  \&quot;type\&quot;: \&quot;formula\&quot;,\n  \&quot;formula\&quot;: {\n      \&quot;expression\&quot;: \&quot;{{notion:block_property:BtVS:00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000:8994905a-074a-415f-9bcf-d1f8b4fa38e4}}/2\&quot;\n  }\n}\n```\n\n#### Why is this happening?\n\nNotion databases allow you to build a fully customizable system for you and your team ‚Äì they provide a place where you can keep all your information in one place, with the ability to build views, filters, and workflows that can be adapted to your needs. \n\nThe formula property helps you take that even further ‚Äì allowing you to perform calculations, create specialized views, and provide an extra layer of insight based on information in other database properties. It helps expand what you can do in Notion databases.\n\nWe are improving the formulas experience so that: \n\n1. It‚Äôs easier to write formulas.\n2. Formula outputs look and feel more native to Notion.\n3. The formula language can fulfill more specific needs.\n\nChanges being made to the API are to ensure parity with the Notion app. \n\n#### What do you need to do?\n\nThis is a non-versioned change that will not affect most developers. As mentioned, the formula property format will still have the same schema in the Public API; only the value of the `formula.expression` field will change.\n\nKeep an eye on this changelog for when the update becomes available in the Public API.\n\n## July 25 - August 7, 2023\n\n- Notion is excited to announce our [Technology Partnership Program](https://www.notion.so/technology-partner-program). üéâ This program is open to companies who have built a public integration (including Link Previews) and are interested in improving and scaling their integration with Notion‚Äôs support. If you think your integration and company could be a fit, [learn more and apply here](https://www.notion.so/technology-partner-program).\n- We‚Äôve updated our API reference docs to include information on Notion‚Äôs [wiki databases and verified pages](https://www.notion.so/help/wikis-and-verified-pages). Updates include:\n  - An overview on wikis in the guide to [working with databases](https://developers.notion.com/docs/working-with-databases#properties).\n  - The [`verification`](https://developers.notion.com/reference/page-property-values#verification) page property was added to the [Page properties](https://developers.notion.com/reference/page-property-values) documentation.\n  - The [Create a database](https://developers.notion.com/reference/create-a-database) and [Query a database](https://developers.notion.com/reference/post-database-query) endpoint documentation was updated to reflect API changes related to wikis. Namely, that querying wiki databases can return both [Page](https://developers.notion.com/reference/page) and [Database](https://developers.notion.com/reference/database) objects.\n- The [Error codes](https://developers.notion.com/reference/status-codes#error-codes) section in the [Status code](https://developers.notion.com/reference/status-codes) page was updated to include examples of the `\&quot;message\&quot;` returned with each type of API error, as well as descriptions of the issue each error code represents.\n- A number of sample cURL commands in our docs were still using an old [Notion Version](https://developers.notion.com/reference/versioning) in their headers. These have all been updated.\n- A clarification was added to the [Authorization guide](https://developers.notion.com/docs/authorization#making-api-requests-with-an-internal-integration) that the [Notion Version](https://developers.notion.com/reference/versioning) is always required in public API request headers.\n\n## July 11 - July 24, 2023\n\n- A new integration [example](https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js/tree/main/examples/parse-text-from-any-block-type) was added to the Notion SDK for JavaScript repo. Read more about the new version [here](https://developers.notion.com/changelog/releasing-notion-version-2022-06-28).\n- Created a new template repository for getting started with the Notion API and the official SDK. [Find it here.](https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-typescript-starter)\n\n### Bug fixes and performance improvements\n\n- Exported many more named types for API response objects in the [official SDK](https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js).\n- Fixed a bug in the official SDK where some API requests would not work due a capitalization issue. (This was a community-submitted PR; thank you @dvanoni!)\n\n## July 6, 2022\n\n### Releasing Notion-Version 2022-06-28\n\n**Update from August 31, 2022**: Page properties can now be retrieved using the page, query database, and search endpoints, in addition to the page properties endpoint.\n\nToday we‚Äôre releasing Notion-Version `2022-06-28` with the following backwards incompatible changes:\n\n- Page properties must be retrieved using the page properties endpoint.\n- Parents are now always direct parents; a parent field has been added to block.\n- Database relations have a type of `single_property` and `dual_property`.\n\nRead more about each of these changes below.\n\n### Page properties must be retrieved using the page properties endpoint\n\nPreviously, the [page object](ref:page) returned from page endpoints, as well as the query database and search endpoint, returned a `properties` field that contained all the page‚Äôs properties along with its value:\n\n```json Previous Version Response\n\&quot;properties\&quot;: {\n    \&quot;Name\&quot;: {\n      \&quot;id\&quot;: \&quot;title\&quot;,\n      \&quot;type\&quot;: \&quot;title\&quot;,\n      \&quot;title\&quot;: [\n        {\n          \&quot;type\&quot;: \&quot;text\&quot;,\n          \&quot;text\&quot;: {\n            \&quot;content\&quot;: \&quot;Avocado\&quot;,\n            \&quot;link\&quot;: null\n          },\n          \&quot;annotations\&quot;: {\n            \&quot;bold\&quot;: false,\n            \&quot;italic\&quot;: false,\n            \&quot;strikethrough\&quot;: false,\n            \&quot;underline\&quot;: false,\n            \&quot;code\&quot;: false,\n            \&quot;color\&quot;: \&quot;default\&quot;\n          },\n          \&quot;plain_text\&quot;: \&quot;Avocado\&quot;,\n          \&quot;href\&quot;: null\n        }\n      ]\n   }\n}\n```\n\nWhile convenient, returning accurate results for all properties resulted in bad performance and timeouts for larger databases or pages with lots of mentions. To combat performance, on March 1st, we [added a disclaimer](ref:property-value-object) that page objects stopped returning accurate results for pages with more than 25 mentions to other objects (which affected properties of type `title`, `rich_text`, `relation`, `people`, `rollup`, and `formula`).\n\nIn October 2021, [we introduced](https://developers.notion.com/changelog/retrieve-page-property-values) a way to more accurately retrieve individual page properties via the [retrieve a page property item endpoint](ref:retrieve-a-page-property). With this endpoint, we‚Äôre able to paginate complex properties that involve additional look-ups.\n\nWith version `2022-06-28`, the `type` and `property` value from page objects are removed. Thus moving forward, all property value retrieval must happen through the retrieve a page property item endpoint.\n\n```json New Version Response\n\&quot;properties\&quot;: {\n    \&quot;Name\&quot;: {\n      \&quot;id\&quot;: \&quot;title\&quot;\n   }\n}\n```\n\nFor more examples of how to use the retrieve a page property item endpoint, our [SDK examples](https://developers.notion.com/page/examples) have been updated to use the retrieve a page property item endpoint.\n\nFor more details about why page properties are so complex, we wrote about it in our [‚ÄúCreating the Notion API‚Äù](https://www.notion.so/blog/creating-the-notion-api) blog post.\n\n### Parents are now always direct parents; a parent field has been added to block\n\nPreviously, when accessing the parent of a database or page, that parent was always either a page, database, or workspace. This is un-faithful to the actual data model of Notion, where the parent may also be another block; for example, you can nest a page under a toggle block.\n\nThe parent field for page and database has been changed so that it is now always the direct parent of that page or database, and a new parent type has been added: `block_id`.\n\nAdditionally, a `parent` field has been added to the block object. Together, these changes allow you to fully traverse Notion‚Äôs tree.\n\nTo emulate the previous behavior of retrieving the page, database, or space parent, you may traverse up the tree using the retrieve a block endpoint. If the parent ‚â† one of those types, retrieve the parent block until it is.\n\nRead more about parent types [here](https://developers.notion.com/reference/parent-object).\n\n### Database relations have a type of `single_property` and `dual_property`\n\nRelation properties in databases objects now have a type of `single_property` or `dual_property`. These can be used to create one way relations between databases as well as two way relations within a database.\n\n### New version of the JavaScript SDK\n\nCoinciding with all of these changes, we've released a new major version (v2.0.0) of the [Notion JavaScript SDK](https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js). To upgrade to this new version, run `npm install @notionhq/client@latest` or `yarn upgrade --latest @notionhq/client` from within your repository.\n\n## June 20 - July 4, 2022\n\n### Features\n\n- Added limited readonly support for database status properties. Read more about status properties [here](https://www.notion.so/help/guides/status-property-gives-clarity-on-tasks).\n  - Status property values are returned in the [Retrieve a page](ref:retrieve-a-page) endpoint. See [Property values](ref:property-value-object) for more information.\n  - Status property configuration is not supported yet. See [Property object](ref:property-object) for more information.\n\n### Bug Fixes\n\n- Added a validation for adding new rollup properties that prevents creating a rollup of another rollup.\n\n## June 6 - June 19, 2022\n\n### Features\n\n- Added support for creating inline databases with `is_inline`. Read more [here](https://developers.notion.com/reference/database).\n- Added support for reading and writing database descriptions with the `description` field. Read more [here](https://developers.notion.com/reference/database).\n\n## May 23 - June 5, 2022\n\n### Bug fixes and performance improvements\n\n- The public API once again supports inline`mailto` links in rich text.\n\n## May 9 - 22, 2022\n\n### Bug fixes and performance improvements\n\n- We now validate URLs used to create inline text links in the public API. For more details on inline links in rich text, see the [Rich text object](ref:rich-text) documentation. \n- The [Search](ref:post-search) endpoint now returns fuzzier matches, including plurals and different verb tenses. This corresponds to fuzzier matches while searching in the Notion app and should result in more search results overall for any given query.\n- Fixed a bug where the integration page at &lt;https://www.notion.so/my-integrations&gt; wouldn't load.\n\n## May 10, 2022\n\n### Link Preview APIs\n\nToday we‚Äôre excited to launch a new set of APIs for developers to build on ‚Äî Link Preview APIs. Over the past six months, we launched link previews with tools like Slack, Trello, Figma, and Asana, allowing users to preview authenticated content in a new structured block. Now, we‚Äôre ready for any developer to build integrations that support link previews in Notion.\n\nWe built link previews to make it easy for users to easily share information in one place using a link. But with a regular link, the information would become automatically stale, making it difficult to share the latest updates among teams. Now, with the new link previews APIs, Notion will let you know when a user pastes a link to a domain you own, let the user authenticate with Notion and your service, and let you unfurl a new link preview block inside Notion.\n\nLearn more about the new link previews APIs [here](https://developers.notion.com/page/link-previews-api), and apply to get access to and build your integration by filling out [this form](https://notionup.typeform.com/to/BXheLK4Z?typeform-source=developers.notion.com).\n\n## April 25 - May 9, 2022\n\n### Bug fixes and performance improvements\n\n- We've shipped a couple of improvements under the hood to make the search and query database endpoints faster. We're actively looking into 500s and timeouts on the query database endpoint in particular.\n- Fixed a bug in the OAuth page picker where Shared pages wouldn't load until the workspace switcher was clicked\n\n## April 11 - 24, 2022\n\n### Bug fixes and performance improvements\n\n- Fixed a bug where some rollups and relations appeared empty when they shouldn't have.\n- Fixed a bug in the query database endpoint where an invalid pagination cursor was being returned.\n\n## March 28 - April 10, 2022\n\nThere was a [company-wide product bug bash](https://www.notion.so/releases)! As a result nothing API-specific to share for these 2 weeks, but we've been hard at work improving test coverage and paring down tech debt.\n\n## March 14 - 27, 2022\n\n### Features\n\n- You can now filter databases on the created at and last edited at timestamps, even if they don't have a corresponding property of that type. Read more [here](https://developers.notion.com/reference/post-database-query-filter#timestamp-filter-object).\n- A [`Retry-After`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Retry-After) response header is now being sent with rate limited request responses. The value of this field is set as an integer number of seconds (in decimal). Requests made after waiting this minimum amount of time should not be rate limited. Read more about our rate limits [here](https://developers.notion.com/reference/request-limits#rate-limits).\n\n### Bug fixes and performance improvements\n\n- Stopped throwing an error when rendering property formulas that hadn't been set up yet in the [Retrieve a page property item](ref:retrieve-a-page-property) endpoint. These formulas now return `null` values.\n\n## March 18, 2022\n\n### Query a database endpoint supports filtering by timestamp\n\nWhen [querying a database](ref:post-database-query) using filters, you previously were only able to build filters using properties that were explicitly defined in the database schema. We've added a new type of filter for the created timestamp and last edited timestamp of any page within the database. This means you can filter by these attributes, even if the database doesn't have a \&quot;Created time\&quot; or \&quot;Last edited time\&quot; _property_.\n\nYou can read more about this filter type [here](ref:post-database-query-filter#timestamp-filter-object), but as a preview here is how you would filter by the created timestamp:\n\n```json\n{\n    \&quot;filter\&quot;: {\n        \&quot;timestamp\&quot;: \&quot;created_time\&quot;,\n        \&quot;created_time\&quot;: {\n          \&quot;past_week\&quot;: {}\n        }\n    }\n}\n```\n\nAnd here's how you would filter by the last edited time:\n\n```json\n{\n    \&quot;filter\&quot;: {\n        \&quot;timestamp\&quot;: \&quot;last_edited_time\&quot;,\n        \&quot;last_edited_time\&quot;: {\n          \&quot;after\&quot;: \&quot;2021-05-10\&quot;\n        }\n    }\n}\n```\n\nNote that you can also use this filter type within a compound filter.\n\n## February 28, 2022 - March 13, 2022\n\n### Features\n\n- Block colors are now supported in the API! Read more about it [here](https://developers.notion.com/changelog/block-colors-are-now-supported-in-the-api).\n\n### Bug fixes and performance improvements\n\n- Rich text objects now properly include template mentions. Read more about this type of text object [here](https://developers.notion.com/reference/rich-text#template-mentions).\n\n## March 8, 2022\n\n### Block colors are now supported in the API\n\nWe have added support for block colors in the Notion Public API. There is now a `color` keyword for the following block types: `paragraph`, `heading_1`, `heading_2`, `heading_3`, `bulleted_list_item`, `numbered_list_item`, `to_do`, `toggle`, `callout`, `quote`, and `table_of_contents`. For these block types, the block color is returned in the [block object](ref:block), and you can use the [update block](ref:update-a-block), [append block children](ref:append-block-children), and [create page](ref:post-page) endpoints to update the color of existing blocks and create new blocks with color.\n\nThe colors supported are `default`, `gray`, `brown`, `orange`, `yellow`, `green`, `blue`, `purple`, `pink`, `red`, `gray_background`, `brown_background`, `orange_background`, `yellow_background`, `green_background`, `blue_background`, `purple_background`, `pink_background`, and `red_background`.\n\n```json Example Block\n{\n    \&quot;object\&quot;: \&quot;block\&quot;,\n    \&quot;id\&quot;: \&quot;79bc0ae2-b002-4ecd-92db-870354734aaf\&quot;,\n    \&quot;created_time\&quot;: \&quot;2022-03-03T22:49:00.000Z\&quot;,\n    \&quot;last_edited_time\&quot;: \&quot;2022-03-03T22:49:00.000Z\&quot;,\n    \&quot;created_by\&quot;: {\n        \&quot;object\&quot;: \&quot;user\&quot;,\n        \&quot;id\&quot;: \&quot;914ff1b3-45c7-48dc-b2c2-be37d21e7695\&quot;\n    },\n    \&quot;last_edited_by\&quot;: {\n        \&quot;object\&quot;:
