}\n}\n&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;For more details, refer to the &lt;a href=\&quot;/reference/block\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;Block object&lt;/a&gt; docs.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;h2 class=\&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;december-15-2021\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-december-15-2021\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;December 15, 2021&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to December 15, 2021\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#december-15-2021\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;Both public and internal integrations now support having more granular capabilities, which enforce what an integration can do and see in a Notion workspace. These capabilities when put together enforce which API endpoints an integration can call, and what content and user related information they are able to see. For further information on capabilities and best practices, see the &lt;a href=\&quot;/reference/capabilities\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;capabilities reference&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;h3 class=\&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;content-capabilities\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-content-capabilities\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Content capabilities&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to Content capabilities\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#content-capabilities\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;Integrations can have any combination of read content, insert content, or update content capabilities.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;ul&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;The &lt;strong&gt;read content&lt;/strong&gt; capability gives the integration access to read existing content in a Notion workspace.&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;The &lt;strong&gt;insert content&lt;/strong&gt; capability gives the integration permission to create new content in a Notion workspace.&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;The &lt;strong&gt;update content&lt;/strong&gt; capability gives the integration permission to update existing content in a Notion workspace.&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;/ul&gt;\n&lt;h3 class=\&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;user-capabilities\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-user-capabilities\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;User capabilities&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to User capabilities\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#user-capabilities\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;Integrations have different levels of user capabilities, which affect how &lt;a href=\&quot;/reference/user\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;user objects&lt;/a&gt; are returned from the Notion API:&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;ul&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;No user information - the integration will not be able to request any information about users. User objects will not include information about the user, including name, profile images, or their email address.&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;User information without email addresses - user objects will include other information about the user, including their name or profile images, but omit the email address.&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;User information with email addresses - user objects will include all information about the user, including name, profile images, and their email address.&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;/ul&gt;\n&lt;h3 class=\&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;limitations\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-limitations\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Limitations&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to Limitations\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#limitations\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;An installed integration can never capabilities will never supersede the capabilities of the user who owns the integration. For example, an integration cannot insert or update on a page if the owner has read-only access.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;h3 class=\&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;existing-integrations\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-existing-integrations\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Existing integrations&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to Existing integrations\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#existing-integrations\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;All existing integrations will continue to have the same functionality as before. Any integrations created before December 15, 2021 automatically will have all content capabilities, and user capabilities that give access to user information including email addresses.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;h3 class=\&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;updating-integrations\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-updating-integrations\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Updating integrations&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to Updating integrations\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#updating-integrations\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;Update the capabilities on an existing integration through &lt;a href=\&quot;https://www.notion.so/my-integrations\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;https://www.notion.so/my-integrations&lt;/a&gt;. After updating a public integration&amp;#x27;s capabilities, users will need to re-authenticate with the integration to apply the new capabilities to their installation. After re-authenticating a public integration with changed capabilities, or updating an internal integration with changed capabilities, the new capabilities will apply to all pages already shared with the integration. For more information on setting capabilities see the &lt;a href=\&quot;/docs/authorization\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot; class=\&quot;doc-link\&quot; data-sidebar=\&quot;authorization\&quot;&gt;Authorization&lt;/a&gt; guide.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;h2 class=\&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;december-14-2021\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-december-14-2021\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;December 14, 2021&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to December 14, 2021\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#december-14-2021\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;\n&lt;h3 class=\&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;time-zone-support\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-time-zone-support\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Time zone support&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to Time zone support\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#time-zone-support\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;We have added an optional &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;time_zone&lt;/code&gt; field (based on the &lt;a href=\&quot;https://www.iana.org/time-zones\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;IANA database&lt;/a&gt; time zone values) to the Date objects. Developers can now explicitly set the time zones of Date property values using the &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;time_zone&lt;/code&gt; field. Once this property is set explicitly, users will be able to see the same time zone in the app. When time zone information is provided in this method, &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;start&lt;/code&gt; and &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;end&lt;/code&gt; cannot contain &lt;a href=\&quot;https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UTC_offset\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;UTC offset&lt;/a&gt;s. In addition when time zone information is provided in dates, &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;start&lt;/code&gt; and &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;end&lt;/code&gt; cannot be dates without time information (i.e. &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;&amp;quot;2020-12-08&amp;quot;&lt;/code&gt;).&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;The public API will always return the &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;time_zone&lt;/code&gt; field as &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;null&lt;/code&gt; when rendering dates and time zone will be displayed as a &lt;a href=\&quot;https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UTC_offset\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;UTC offset&lt;/a&gt; in the &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;start&lt;/code&gt; and &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;end&lt;/code&gt; date fields.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;h2 class=\&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;november-17-2021\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-november-17-2021\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;November 17, 2021&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to November 17, 2021\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#november-17-2021\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;\n&lt;h3 class=\&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;synced-block-link-to-page-and-template-block-types-are-now-supported-in-the-api\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-synced-block-link-to-page-and-template-block-types-are-now-supported-in-the-api\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Synced Block, Link to Page and Template block types are now supported in the API&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to Synced Block, Link to Page and Template block types are now supported in the API\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#synced-block-link-to-page-and-template-block-types-are-now-supported-in-the-api\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;We have added support for adding and retrieving &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;synced_block&lt;/code&gt;, &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;link_to_page&lt;/code&gt; and &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;template&lt;/code&gt; block types.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;h4 class=\&quot;heading heading-4 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;synced_block-block-type\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-synced-block-block-type\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;synced_block&lt;/code&gt; block type&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to [object Object]\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#synced_block-block-type\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h4&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;Similar to the UI, there are two versions of a &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;synced_block&lt;/code&gt; -- the original block that was created first and doesn&amp;#x27;t yet sync with anything else, and the reference blocks that are synced to the original synced block.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Original Synced Block&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br/&gt;\nTo create a &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;synced_block&lt;/code&gt;, the developer needs to create an original synced block. Developers will be able to identify the original &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;synced_block&lt;/code&gt; because it does not &amp;quot;sync_from&amp;quot; any other block (i.e. the &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;synced_from&lt;/code&gt; property is set to &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;null&lt;/code&gt;).&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;This is an example of an &amp;quot;original&amp;quot; &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;synced_block&lt;/code&gt;. Note that all of the blocks available to be synced in another &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;synced_block&lt;/code&gt; are captured in the &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;children&lt;/code&gt; property.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;div class=\&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar\&quot; role=\&quot;tablist\&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=\&quot;true\&quot; class=\&quot;CodeTabs_active\&quot; role=\&quot;tab\&quot; type=\&quot;button\&quot;&gt;synced_block (original)&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;CodeTabs-inner\&quot; role=\&quot;tabpanel\&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang-json theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;json\&quot; name=\&quot;synced_block (original)\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;{\n    &amp;quot;type&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;synced_block&amp;quot;,\n    &amp;quot;synced_block&amp;quot;: {\n        &amp;quot;synced_from&amp;quot;: null,\n        &amp;quot;children&amp;quot;: [\n            {\n                &amp;quot;callout&amp;quot;: {\n                    &amp;quot;text&amp;quot;: [\n                        {\n                            &amp;quot;type&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;text&amp;quot;,\n                            &amp;quot;text&amp;quot;: {\n                                &amp;quot;content&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Callout in synced block&amp;quot;\n                            }\n                        }\n                    ]\n                }\n            }\n        ]\n    }\n}\n&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Reference Synced Blocks&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br/&gt;\nTo sync the content of the original &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;synced_block&lt;/code&gt; with another &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;synced_block&lt;/code&gt;, the developer simply needs to refer to that &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;synced_block&lt;/code&gt; using the  &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;synced_from&lt;/code&gt; property.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;Below is an example of a &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;synced_block&lt;/code&gt; referring to another &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;synced_block&lt;/code&gt;. Note that only &amp;quot;original&amp;quot; synced blocks can be referenced in the &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;synced_from&lt;/code&gt; property.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;div class=\&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar\&quot; role=\&quot;tablist\&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=\&quot;true\&quot; class=\&quot;CodeTabs_active\&quot; role=\&quot;tab\&quot; type=\&quot;button\&quot;&gt;synced_block (reference to original) in request body&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;CodeTabs-inner\&quot; role=\&quot;tabpanel\&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang-json theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;json\&quot; name=\&quot;synced_block (reference to original) in request body\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;{\n    &amp;quot;type&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;synced_block&amp;quot;,\n    &amp;quot;synced_block&amp;quot;: {\n        &amp;quot;synced_from&amp;quot;: {\n            &amp;quot;block_id&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;original_synced_block_id&amp;quot;\n        }\n    }\n}\n&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;Below is the example response after creating the &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;synced_block&lt;/code&gt; above. We can tell that the content from the original synced block is synced with this one because this block has children even though we didn&amp;#x27;t explicitly set the children in the body of our API call above (i.e. &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;has_children&lt;/code&gt; property on the reference block is &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;true&lt;/code&gt;).&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;div class=\&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar\&quot; role=\&quot;tablist\&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=\&quot;true\&quot; class=\&quot;CodeTabs_active\&quot; role=\&quot;tab\&quot; type=\&quot;button\&quot;&gt;synced_block (reference to original) in response body&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;CodeTabs-inner\&quot; role=\&quot;tabpanel\&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang-json theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;json\&quot; name=\&quot;synced_block (reference to original) in response body\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;{\n    &amp;quot;object&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;list&amp;quot;,\n    &amp;quot;results&amp;quot;: [\n        {\n            &amp;quot;object&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;block&amp;quot;,\n            &amp;quot;id&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;block_id&amp;quot;,\n            &amp;quot;created_time&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;2021-11-17T22:17:00.000Z&amp;quot;,\n            &amp;quot;last_edited_time&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;2021-11-17T22:17:00.000Z&amp;quot;,\n            &amp;quot;has_children&amp;quot;: true,\n            &amp;quot;archived&amp;quot;: false,\n            &amp;quot;type&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;synced_block&amp;quot;,\n            &amp;quot;synced_block&amp;quot;: {\n                &amp;quot;synced_from&amp;quot;: {\n                    &amp;quot;type&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;block_id&amp;quot;,\n                    &amp;quot;block_id&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;original_synced_block_id&amp;quot;\n                }\n            }\n        }\n    ],\n    &amp;quot;next_cursor&amp;quot;: null,\n    &amp;quot;has_more&amp;quot;: false\n}\n&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;blockquote class=\&quot;callout callout_warn\&quot; theme=\&quot;üöß\&quot;&gt;&lt;h2 class=\&quot;callout-heading\&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=\&quot;callout-icon\&quot;&gt;üöß&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p&gt;Important notes&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;&lt;ol&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;The bot must have access to both the original and reference synced blocks&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;Similar to the UI, we don&amp;#x27;t support changes to &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;synced_from&lt;/code&gt; at this time&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;/ol&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;\n&lt;h4 class=\&quot;heading heading-4 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;link_to_page-block-type\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-link-to-page-block-type\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;link_to_page&lt;/code&gt; block type&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to [object Object]\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#link_to_page-block-type\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h4&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;We have added support for adding and retrieving &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;link_to_page&lt;/code&gt; block types. Using this block type, developers can now create page links to other pages (using the &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;page_id&lt;/code&gt; property) and full page databases (using the &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;rich_text&lt;/code&gt;! href=\&quot;#september-21-2021\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;\n&lt;h3 class=\&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;workspace-level-tokens-for-public-integrations-will-be-deprecated-soon-migrate-your-oauth-flows\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-workspace-level-tokens-for-public-integrations-will-be-deprecated-soon-migrate-your-o-auth-flows\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Workspace-level tokens for public integrations will be deprecated soon; migrate your OAuth flows&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to Workspace-level tokens for public integrations will be deprecated soon; migrate your OAuth flows\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#workspace-level-tokens-for-public-integrations-will-be-deprecated-soon-migrate-your-oauth-flows\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;Starting today we will be changing who can authorize public integrations in Notion workspaces. The previously released authorization method will be fully deprecated on October 19.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;h4 class=\&quot;heading heading-4 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;about-the-change\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-about-the-change\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;About the change&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to About the change\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#about-the-change\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h4&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;Currently OAuth tokens function on a workspace level: only admins in a workspace can grant access and there can only be one token per workspace per integration. After a brief transition period (see &amp;quot;How to prepare for this change&amp;quot; below) we will be switching exclusively to user-level tokens. These can be granted by any admin or member in the workspace, and there can be as many tokens per workspace as there are admins and members in the workspace. &lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;See the table for the differences between these two methods:&lt;/p&gt;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n&lt;div class=\&quot;rdmd-table\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;rdmd-table-inner\&quot;&gt;&lt;table&gt;&lt;thead&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;th style=\&quot;text-align:left\&quot;&gt;&lt;/th&gt;&lt;th style=\&quot;text-align:left\&quot;&gt;Workspace-level tokens (old)&lt;/th&gt;&lt;th style=\&quot;text-align:left\&quot;&gt;User-level tokens (new)&lt;/th&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/thead&gt;&lt;tbody&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=\&quot;text-align:left\&quot;&gt;Who can go through OAuth and grant access&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=\&quot;text-align:left\&quot;&gt;Admins only&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=\&quot;text-align:left\&quot;&gt;Admins and members&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=\&quot;text-align:left\&quot;&gt;Number of access tokens per workspace&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=\&quot;text-align:left\&quot;&gt;1&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=\&quot;text-align:left\&quot;&gt;Up to N, where N is the number of admins and members&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=\&quot;text-align:left\&quot;&gt;Who can go through OAuth and reauthorize access for a given token&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=\&quot;text-align:left\&quot;&gt;Only the original user who went through OAuth to grant the token&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=\&quot;text-align:left\&quot;&gt;Only the original user who went through OAuth to grant the token&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=\&quot;text-align:left\&quot;&gt;OAuth token response&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=\&quot;text-align:left\&quot;&gt;Contains an &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;owner&lt;/code&gt; field with the value &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;{ workspace: true }&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=\&quot;text-align:left\&quot;&gt;Contains an &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;owner&lt;/code&gt; field with the value &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;{ user: &amp;lt;API user object&amp;gt; }&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=\&quot;text-align:left\&quot;&gt;What resources an integration has access to&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=\&quot;text-align:left\&quot;&gt;Pages/databases the installing user chooses via the page picker during OAuth; pages/databases the installing user and other users in the workspace share with the integration via the Page menu;  children of pages/databases that were shared with the integration&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=\&quot;text-align:left\&quot;&gt;Pages/databases the installing user chooses via the page picker during OAuth; pages/databases the installing user shares with the integration via the Page menu;  children of pages/databases that were shared with the integration&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=\&quot;text-align:left\&quot;&gt;What an integration can do with resources it has access to&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=\&quot;text-align:left\&quot;&gt;Read and write&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=\&quot;text-align:left\&quot;&gt;Read and write&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/tbody&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;h4 class=\&quot;heading heading-4 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;how-to-prepare-for-this-change\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-how-to-prepare-for-this-change\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;How to prepare for this change:&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to How to prepare for this change:\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#how-to-prepare-for-this-change\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h4&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;This change only affects public integrations; that is, integrations that can be installed across many workspaces via OAuth. It does not affect internal integrations.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;ol&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;Ensure that you can store and handle multiple Notion API tokens per workspace where your integration is granted access. You may map tokens directly to the &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;bot_id&lt;/code&gt; which is returned in the OAuth token response and is guaranteed to be unique per API token. \n&lt;ul&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;To avoid overwriting tokens, do not map the token to the &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;workspace_id&lt;/code&gt; returned in the OAuth token response, since a workspace may have multiple tokens. Do not map the token to the &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;owner.user.id&lt;/code&gt; in the OAuth token response, since a user may install your integration in multiple workspaces.&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;/ul&gt;\n&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;Add &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;&amp;amp;owner=user&lt;/code&gt; to your OAuth authorization URL (the url starting with &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;https://api.notion.com/v1/oauth/authorize&lt;/code&gt;) once your application is ready for user-level tokens.&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;/ol&gt;\n&lt;h4 class=\&quot;heading heading-4 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;what-to-expect-on-october-19\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-what-to-expect-on-october-19\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;What to expect on October 19&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to What to expect on October 19\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#what-to-expect-on-october-19\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h4&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;On October 19, we will migrate all existing workspace-level tokens to user-level tokens. We will also default to creating user-level tokens when a user goes through OAuth, regardless of the &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;owner&lt;/code&gt; parameter in the OAuth URL.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;h2 class=\&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;september-17-2021\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-september-17-2021\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;September 17, 2021&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to September 17, 2021\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#september-17-2021\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;\n&lt;h3 class=\&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;database-objects-now-contain-url\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-database-objects-now-contain-url\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Database objects now contain url&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a href=\&quot;#database-objects-now-contain-url\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=\&quot;/reference/database\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;Database class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Unknown Keys Will Fail Validation&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to Unknown Keys Will Fail Validation\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#unknown-keys-will-fail-validation\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h4&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;Previously, our endpoints used to only validate against the expected keys in both request body parameters as well as query parameters resulting in some ambiguity between incorrect behavior and invalid inputs. Going forward, to improve the developer experience we will be raising validation errors if keys that are not supported by our API are passed in to requests.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;blockquote class=\&quot;callout callout_info\&quot; theme=\&quot;üìò\&quot;&gt;&lt;h2 class=\&quot;callout-heading\&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=\&quot;callout-icon\&quot;&gt;üìò&lt;/span&gt;&lt;p&gt;Migration Tip&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;&lt;p&gt;To safely migrate to &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;2021-08-16&lt;/code&gt;, we recommend thoroughly testing your API calls against the &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;2021-08-16&lt;/code&gt; version, to see if you get any validation errors due to this change. If you do, remove any parameters that are rejected due to unknown keys.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;\n&lt;h4 class=\&quot;heading heading-4 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;changes-to-array-rollup-property-types\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-changes-to-array-rollup-property-types\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Changes to Array Rollup Property Types&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to Changes to Array Rollup Property Types\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#changes-to-array-rollup-property-types\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h4&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;Starting with the Notion-Version header &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;2021-08-16&lt;/code&gt;, we are introducing a change to the response for rollup properties on a page which are arrays. class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#oauth-improvements\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;We&amp;#x27;ve made improvements to the OAuth flow to make it easier to use.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;We now show the page picker on reauthorization.&lt;/strong&gt; Just like before, the user who initially authorized an integration can reauthorize by going through OAuth a second time. The page picker step will remember which pages have already been shared with the integration, if any, and let users share or un-share additional pages.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Users can search for pages to share with an integration.&lt;/strong&gt; Previously, users could only select pages at the top level of the Workspace, Shared section, or Private pages section to share with an integration, but we&amp;#x27;ve added a search bar so users can search for and select any page in their workspace. &lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;We also updated the page picker to only show pages for which the user has Full Access permission. Previously, the page picker show any pages for which the user had at least Can View permission, but would show an error when they tried to give the permission access to those pages.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;Other OAuth behavior has not changed: only admins can go through OAuth, and only the original person originally added an integration via OAuth can go through the flow again.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;figure&gt;&lt;span aria-label=\&quot;1164\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;json\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;{\n  &amp;quot;object&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;page&amp;quot;,\n  &amp;quot;id&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;251d2b5f-268c-4de2-afe9-c71ff92ca95c&amp;quot;,\n\t&amp;quot;created_time&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;2020-03-17T19:10:04.968Z&amp;quot;,\n\t&amp;quot;last_edited_time&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;2020-03-17T21:49:37.913Z&amp;quot;,\n  &amp;quot;parent&amp;quot;: {\n    &amp;quot;type&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;database_id&amp;quot;,\n    &amp;quot;database_id&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;48f8fee9-cd79-4180-bc2f-ec0398253067&amp;quot;\n  },\n  &amp;quot;archived&amp;quot;: false,\n  &amp;quot;url&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;https://www.notion.so/Avocado-251d2b5f268c4de2afe9c71ff92ca95c&amp;quot;,\n  &amp;quot;properties&amp;quot;: {\n    &amp;quot;Name&amp;quot;: {\n      &amp;quot;id&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;title&amp;quot;,\n      &amp;quot;type&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;title&amp;quot;,\n      &amp;quot;title&amp;quot;: [\n        {\n          &amp;quot;type&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;text&amp;quot;,\n          &amp;quot;text&amp;quot;: {\n            &amp;quot;content&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Avocado&amp;quot;,\n            &amp;quot;link&amp;quot;: null\n          },\n          &amp;quot;annotations&amp;quot;: {\n            &amp;quot;bold&amp;quot;: false,\n            &amp;quot;italic&amp;quot;: false,\n            &amp;quot;strikethrough&amp;quot;: false,\n            &amp;quot;underline&amp;quot;: false,\n            &amp;quot;code&amp;quot;: false,\n            &amp;quot;color&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;default&amp;quot;\n          },\n          &amp;quot;plain_text&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Avocado&amp;quot;,\n          &amp;quot;href&amp;quot;: null\n        }\n      ]\n    }\n  }\n}\n&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;This impacts endpoints that return page object: the &lt;a href=\&quot;/reference/page\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;pages&lt;/a&gt; endpoints and &lt;a href=\&quot;/reference/post-database-query\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;query database&lt;/a&gt; endpoint.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;h2 class=\&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;june-28-2021\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-june-28-2021\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;June 28, 2021&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to June 28, 2021\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#june-28-2021\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;\n&lt;h3 class=\&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;last-edited-and-created-time-properties-are-now-rounded-to-the-nearest-minute\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-last-edited-and-created-time-properties-are-now-rounded-to-the-nearest-minute\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Last edited and created time properties are now rounded to the nearest minute&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to Last edited and created time properties are now rounded to the nearest minute\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#last-edited-and-created-time-properties-are-now-rounded-to-the-nearest-minute\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;Starting July 1st, the &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;last_edited_time&lt;/code&gt; and &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;created_time&lt;/code&gt; properties will be rounded down to the closest minute for &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;page&lt;/code&gt;, &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;database&lt;/code&gt; , and &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;block&lt;/code&gt; objects. Previously, this behavior was inconsistent with some times being rounded and others not.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;h2 class=\&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;june-23-2021\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-june-23-2021\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;June 23, 2021&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to June 23, 2021\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#june-23-2021\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;\n&lt;h3 class=\&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;database-objects-now-return-parent\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-database-objects-now-return-parent\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Database objects now return parent&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to Database objects now return parent\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#database-objects-now-return-parent\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;Database objects now return a &lt;a href=\&quot;/reference/database#page-parent\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;parent property&lt;/a&gt;. Databases can have pages or workspaces as parents.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;div class=\&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar\&quot; role=\&quot;tablist\&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=\&quot;true\&quot; class=\&quot;CodeTabs_active\&quot; role=\&quot;tab\&quot; type=\&quot;button\&quot;&gt;JSON&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;CodeTabs-inner\&quot; role=\&quot;tabpanel\&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang-json theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;json\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;{\n  &amp;quot;parent&amp;quot;: {\n    &amp;quot;type&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;page_id&amp;quot;,\n    &amp;quot;page_id&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;b8595b75-abd1-4cad-8dfe-f935a8ef57cb&amp;quot;\n}\n&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;h3 class=\&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;other-improvements-and-fixes\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-other-improvements-and-fixes\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Other Improvements and Fixes&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to Other Improvements and Fixes\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#other-improvements-and-fixes\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;\n&lt;ul&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;Inline database mentions are now included in &lt;a href=\&quot;/reference/rich-text#database-mentions\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;rich_text mention&lt;/a&gt; responses.&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;When an integration does not have access to a &lt;a href=\&quot;/reference/rich-text#page-mentions\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;page or database mention&lt;/a&gt;, we will no longer completely omit the mention. The mention will be returned with just the ID but without detailed information (title will appear as &amp;quot;Untitled&amp;quot; and annotations will be default).&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;When integrations are added to pages inside collections they can now always update page properties, even when the integration does not have access to the parent database. However, integrations will not be able to add new &lt;a href=\&quot;/reference/page#select-property-values\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;select&lt;/a&gt; or &lt;a href=\&quot;/reference/page#multi-select-property-values\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;multi-select&lt;/a&gt; properties through the create or update page endpoints without the ability to edit the database parent.&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;/ul&gt;\n&lt;h2 class=\&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;june-15-2021\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-june-15-2021\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;June 15, 2021&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to June 15, 2021\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#june-15-2021\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;\n&lt;h3 class=\&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;select-values-can-now-be-dynamically-created-via-create-and-update-page-endpoints--other-updates-since-public-beta-launch\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-select-values-can-now-be-dynamically-created-via-create-and-update-page-endpoints-other-updates-since-public-beta-launch\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Select values can now be dynamically created via Create and Update Page endpoints + other updates since public beta launch&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to Select values can now be dynamically created via Create and Update Page endpoints + other updates since public beta launch\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#select-values-can-now-be-dynamically-created-via-create-and-update-page-endpoints--other-updates-since-public-beta-launch\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;You can now dynamically create new options for &lt;a href=\&quot;/reference/database#select-configuration\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;Select&lt;/a&gt; or  &lt;a href=\&quot;/reference/database#multi-select-configuration\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;Multi-Select properties&lt;/a&gt; when using the &lt;a href=\&quot;/reference/post-page\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;Create Page&lt;/a&gt; and &lt;a href=\&quot;/reference/patch-page\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;Update Page&lt;/a&gt; endpoints. When specifying an option that does not exist in the database schema already, the option will now be created and the database schema updated accordingly. &lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;div class=\&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar\&quot; role=\&quot;tablist\&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=\&quot;true\&quot; class=\&quot;CodeTabs_active\&quot; role=\&quot;tab\&quot; type=\&quot;button\&quot;&gt;JSON&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;CodeTabs-inner\&quot; role=\&quot;tabpanel\&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang-json theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;json\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;{\n  &amp;quot;properties&amp;quot;: {\n    &amp;quot;Food group&amp;quot;: {\n      &amp;quot;multi_select&amp;quot;: [{&amp;quot;name&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Vegetable&amp;quot;},{&amp;quot;name&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Fruit&amp;quot;}]\n    }\n  }\n}\n&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;In the above &lt;a href=\&quot;/reference/page-property-value\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;property values&lt;/a&gt; example: Previously, if either &amp;quot;Vegetable&amp;quot; or &amp;quot;Fruit&amp;quot; did not already exist as an option in the database schema, an error would be returned that these are not valid Select options. Now, these options will be created dynamically.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Bug Fixes&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;ul&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;The title property of a page can be set, and a page can be archived or un-archived, even when the page does not belong to a database.&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;&lt;a href=\&quot;/reference/get-page\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;Retrieving pages&lt;/a&gt; that are shared with an integration, but where the page&amp;#x27;s parent is not shared, no longer erroneously returns a 404.&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;/ul&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Other Changes&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;ul&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;&lt;a href=\&quot;/reference/post-search\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;Search endpoint&lt;/a&gt; now returns untitled pages.&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;Applies to &lt;a href=\&quot;versioning#changes-by-version\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;version 2021-05-13&lt;/a&gt; and later only: The &lt;a href=\&quot;/reference/post-database-query\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;Query Database&lt;/a&gt; endpoint no longer accepts query parameters ‚Äì these should be sent as body parameters.&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;/ul&gt;\n&lt;h2 class=\&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;may-19-2021\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-may-19-2021\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;May 19, 2021&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to May 19, 2021\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#may-19-2021\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;\n&lt;h3 class=\&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;notion-version-header-will-be-required-starting-june-1-2021\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-notion-version-header-will-be-required-starting-june-1-2021\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&amp;quot;Notion-Version&amp;quot; header will be required starting June 1, 2021&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to &amp;quot;Notion-Version&amp;quot; header will be required starting June 1, 2021\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#notion-version-header-will-be-required-starting-june-1-2021\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;The Notion API has recommended using an explicit version to every HTTP request, using the &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;Notion-Version&lt;/code&gt; header. &lt;strong&gt;For integrations created after June 1, 2021 an explicit version on every request will become required&lt;/strong&gt;. After July 1, 2021, integrations created before June 1, 2021 will also have the same requirement. Today, the most recent version is &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;&amp;quot;2021-05-13&amp;quot;&lt;/code&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;h4 class=\&quot;heading heading-4 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;is-my-integration-affected-what-should-i-do-to-update\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-is-my-integration-affected-what-should-i-do-to-update\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Is my integration affected? What should I do to update?&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to Is my integration affected? What should I do to update?\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#is-my-integration-affected-what-should-i-do-to-update\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h4&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;This requirement will not break your existing integration; however, we will start enforcing this requirement for all API requests on July 1st. Starting July 1st, if you don&amp;#x27;t send the Notion-Version header with your Notion API calls, you will get a &lt;a href=\&quot;/reference/errors\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;&amp;quot;missing_version&amp;quot;&lt;/code&gt; error&lt;/a&gt;. Learn more about how the Notion API &lt;a href=\&quot;/reference/versioning\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;handles versioning&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;If you&amp;#x27;ve been using examples copied from documentation or example code since the public beta, including using the &lt;a href=\&quot;https://github.com/makenotion/notion-sdk-js\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;Notion SDK for JavaScript&lt;/a&gt;, your existing code should continue to work as expected.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;Otherwise, please make one of the two following changes before July 1:&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;ol&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;Add &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;Notion-Version: 2021-05-11&lt;/code&gt; in the header when making requests (no other code change is needed).&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;li&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Recommended&lt;/strong&gt;: Add &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;Notion-Version: 2021-05-13&lt;/code&gt; in the header when making requests.  Making this change will move you to our newest version which includes the following breaking change.&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;/ol&gt;\n&lt;h4 class=\&quot;heading heading-4 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;breaking-changes-in-version-2021-05-13\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-breaking-changes-in-version-2021-05-13\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Breaking changes in version &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;2021-05-13&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to Breaking changes in version \&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#breaking-changes-in-version-2021-05-13\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h4&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;The &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;type&lt;/code&gt; of &lt;a href=\&quot;/reference/page-property-value\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;property value objects&lt;/a&gt; for rich text properties has changed from &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;&amp;quot;text&amp;quot;&lt;/code&gt; to &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;&amp;quot;rich_text&amp;quot;&lt;/code&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;When &lt;a href=\&quot;/reference/post-page\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;creating pages&lt;/a&gt; and &lt;a href=\&quot;/reference/patch-page\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;updating page properties&lt;/a&gt;, update page property values that are rich text to use the key &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;rich_text&lt;/code&gt; instead of &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;text&lt;/code&gt;. Similarly when &lt;a href=\&quot;/reference/get-page\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;retrieving a page&lt;/a&gt;, rich text properties will be returned with the &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;type&lt;/code&gt;  &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;&amp;quot;text&amp;quot;&lt;/code&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;This change helps distinguish between the property type, and the inner text values of &lt;a href=\&quot;/reference/rich-text\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;rich text object&lt;/a&gt;, which have the key &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;text&lt;/code&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;To illustrate this change, here is an example of how the &lt;a href=\&quot;/reference/page\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;page object&lt;/a&gt;&amp;#x27;s &lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang- theme-light\&quot; }\n        }\n      ]\n    }\n  }\n  /* remaining details omitted */\n}\n&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;div class=\&quot;CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;CodeTabs-toolbar\&quot; role=\&quot;tablist\&quot;&gt;&lt;button aria-selected=\&quot;true\&quot; class=\&quot;CodeTabs_active\&quot; role=\&quot;tab\&quot; type=\&quot;button\&quot;&gt;JavaScript&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;CodeTabs-inner\&quot; role=\&quot;tabpanel\&quot;&gt;&lt;pre&gt;&lt;button aria-label=\&quot;Copy Code\&quot; class=\&quot;rdmd-code-copy fa\&quot;&gt;&lt;/button&gt;&lt;code class=\&quot;rdmd-code lang-js theme-light\&quot; data-lang=\&quot;js\&quot; name=\&quot;\&quot; tabindex=\&quot;0\&quot;&gt;// After (in requests and responses with version 2021-05-13)\n{\n  &amp;quot;object&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;page&amp;quot;,\n  &amp;quot;properties&amp;quot;: {\n    &amp;quot;Description&amp;quot;: {\n      &amp;quot;type&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;rich_text&amp;quot;,\n      &amp;quot;rich_text&amp;quot;: [\n        {\n          &amp;quot;type&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;text&amp;quot;,\n          &amp;quot;text&amp;quot;: { &amp;quot;content&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Hello World&amp;quot; }\n        }\n      ]\n    }\n  }\n  /* remaining details omitted */\n}\n&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;h2 class=\&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;may-18-2021\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-may-18-2021\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;May 18, 2021&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to May 18, 2021\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#may-18-2021\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;\n&lt;h3 class=\&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;initial-users-may-reauthorize-a-public-integration-using-oauth\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-initial-users-may-reauthorize-a-public-integration-using-o-auth\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Initial users may reauthorize a public integration using OAuth&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to Initial users may reauthorize a public integration using OAuth\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#initial-users-may-reauthorize-a-public-integration-using-oauth\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;Public integrations use OAuth to &lt;a href=\&quot;https://developers.notion.com/docs/authorization#prompting-users-to-add-an-integration\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;request authorization from a user&lt;/a&gt; before being added to a Notion workspace. Previously, once an integration was added to a workspace, no users were able to reauthorize the same integration in that workspace. This change allows the user who initially added the integration to complete the authorization flow more than once. This improvement helps integrations avoid a potential dead end in user flows.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;Integrations do not need to make any updates to take advantage of this new capability. An integration may simply link or redirect a user to the authorization URL, the same as the first authorization. During reauthorization the user will not see the page picker. The access token received at the end of reauthorization will be the same as the initial access token. This capability is available immediately.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;Please be aware that other previous limitations still exist. Only users with admin access level in a workspace can add an integration. Integrations can only be added to a workspace by one user.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;h2 class=\&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;may-13-2021\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-may-13-2021\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;May 13, 2021&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to May 13, 2021\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#may-13-2021\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;\n&lt;h3 class=\&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;hello-world-the-notion-api-is-now-in-public-beta\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-hello-world-the-notion-api-is-now-in-public-beta\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Hello world, the Notion API is now in public beta&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to Hello world, the Notion API is now in public beta\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#hello-world-the-notion-api-is-now-in-public-beta\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;The Notion API is now available for all developers to explore and build upon. Integrations built on the API are available to all Notion users, on free or paid plans.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;In this public beta release, you&amp;#x27;ll find many of the fundamental parts of Notion: reading and writing to pages, working with users, and the deep and powerful world of Notion databases. The API itself offers foundational features such as authorization, pagination, limits, and more. This is enough to build many interesting integrations we&amp;#x27;ve heard Notion users are excited to use. We&amp;#x27;re excited to see what you&amp;#x27;ll build for all of us. &lt;a href=\&quot;https://developers.notion.com/docs/getting-started\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;‚Üí Get started&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;Our goal is to establish that the Notion API is robust, easy to use, and trustworthy. In public beta, we‚Äôll continue to add new features and making significant changes based on your feedback. Once the most important improvements are included, the API will transition from public beta to general availability. you‚Äôll have everything you need to build integrations teams and businesses can depend on.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;A special thanks to the all developers who experimented, explored, and shared their ideas with us - both in the private beta and those following along.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;h2 class=\&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;may-4-2021\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-may-4-2021\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;May 4, 2021&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to May 4, 2021\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#may-4-2021\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;\n&lt;h3 class=\&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;public-integration-type-extends-access-to-multiple-workspaces-using-oauth\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-public-integration-type-extends-access-to-multiple-workspaces-using-o-auth\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Public integration type extends access to multiple workspaces using OAuth&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to Public integration type extends access to multiple workspaces using OAuth\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#public-integration-type-extends-access-to-multiple-workspaces-using-oauth\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;The Notion API has added a new integration type: Public OAuth integrations. If you&amp;#x27;re building a product or service for Notion users outside your own team - public integrations are for developers like you. &lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;In order to create and configure an integration, its type, name, avatar, and other related settings, the &lt;a href=\&quot;https://www.notion.com/my-integrations\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;My integrations&lt;/a&gt; page is now available.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;Public integrations use OAuth to request permission to access pages and databases in new workspaces. Once the user accepts, the integration can receive a separate access token for resources in the user&amp;#x27;s workspace.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;Existing integrations are now known as internal integrations. We no longer call the bearer token you previously used an API Key. It&amp;#x27;s now known as an integration token. You can keep your bearer token around - it will continue to work just the same.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;Learn how to implement these changes in the &lt;a href=\&quot;https://developers.notion.com/docs/authorization\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;authorization guide&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;h2 class=\&quot;heading heading-2 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;may-3-2021\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-may-3-2021\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;May 3, 2021&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to May 3, 2021\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#may-3-2021\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h2&gt;\n&lt;h3 class=\&quot;heading heading-3 header-scroll\&quot; align=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-anchor anchor waypoint\&quot; id=\&quot;search-is-now-available-in-the-api\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\&quot;heading-text\&quot;&gt;&lt;div id=\&quot;section-search-is-now-available-in-the-api\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility\&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Search is now available in the API&lt;/div&gt;&lt;a aria-label=\&quot;Skip link to Search is now available in the API\&quot; class=\&quot;heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor\&quot; href=\&quot;#search-is-now-available-in-the-api\&quot;&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;Using the new &lt;a href=\&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/post-search\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;search endpoint&lt;/a&gt;, you can query all pages and databases users have shared with your integration.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;The query you provide filters results by matching against the page title. The results also include matches against subpages of pages users have shared with your integration. This endpoint can be helpful when onboarding a new user and trying to find the page they just shared with your integration.&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;We recommend transitioning away from using the &lt;a href=\&quot;https://developers.notion.com/reference/get-databases\&quot; target=\&quot;\&quot; title=\&quot;\&quot;&gt;list databases endpoint&lt;/a&gt;. The search endpoint provides all the same functionality - and
